ACTIVATE_EXPLODE_STATE.description: Activates a specific explode state in an assembly.

description: Activate insert mode before or after a specific feature.

ACTIVATE_LAYER_STATE.description: Activates a layer state in a solid model. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

ACTIVATE_SIMPREP.description: Activates a simplified representation of a model. This works only for assemblies, but not for parts.

ACTIVATE_WORKSPACE.description: Activate a workspace for the active PDMLink server.

ACTIVATE_XSEC.description: Activates a cross section of the current model by its name or by reference.

ADD_ANNOTATION_ELEMENT.description: Adds a new annotation element to an annotation feature.

ADD_ANNOTATION_ELEMENT_REF.description: Adds a standard, surface or chain reference to an annotation element.

ADD_ANNOTATION_ELEMENT_REFS.description: Adds standard, surface or chain references to an annotation element.

ADD_ANNOTATION_ELEMENTS.description: Adds an array of annotation elements to an annotation feature.

ADD_ARRAY_ELEM.description: Appends a new element to the end of an of type parameter, reference or array. That means an array can be an elements of another array.

ADD_COMB_VIEW_ANNOTATIONS.description: Adds annotations to a combined view. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

ADD_CONSTRAINTS.description: Adds further constraints to a placed component.

ADD_DRW_MDL.description: Adds a model to a drawing.

ADD_DRW_NOTE_LEADER.description: Adds one leader or an array of leaders to a drawing note.

ADD_DRW_SYMBOL_LEADER.description: Adds one leader or an array of leaders to a drawing symbol.

ADD_DRW_TABLE_COL.description: Adds a column to an existing drawing table.

ADD_DRW_TABLE_ROW.description: Adds a row to an existing drawing table.

ADD_MAP_ELEM.description: Adds a new element to a map.

ADD_NC_HEAD.description: Adds a NC head to an existing workcell.

ADD_RELATIONS.description: Adds an array of relations to a Creo Elements/Pro model, component or a feature.

ADD_SEARCH_PATH.description: Temporary adds a path to the search paths. This command will not modify the Creo Elements/Pro file. After restarting Creo Elements/Pro this setting is lost.

ADD_SELBUFFER.description: Adds a reference or an array of reference to the selection buffer.

ASSEMBLE.description: Assembles a library component by specifying the constraints.

body: ASSEMBLE_EX ${1:input_mdl_reference} ${2:input_array_of_STRUCT_constraint_or_constraint_set} ${3| ,input_assembly_target_ref|} ${4| ,MECHANISM|} ${4/(MECHANISM)/${1:+RIGID PIN SLIDER CYLINDER PLANAR BALL WELD BEARING GENERAL 6DOF SLOT USER_DEFINED}/} ${5| ,FREEZE_FAILED|} ${5/(FREEZE_FAILED)/${1:+input_BOOL_freeze}/} ${6| ,MEASURECOPY|} ${6/(MEASURECOPY)/${1:+input_BOOL_measurecopy}/} ${7| ,RELATION_LINE|} ${7/(RELATION_LINE)/${1:+input_udf_ref}/} ${7/(RELATION_LINE)/${1:+output_param1}/} ${7/(RELATION_LINE)/${1:+output_param2}/}
ASSEMBLE_EX.description: Assembles a library component by specifying the constraints via an array. This commend has the same functionality as an block, but it allows to store the constraints in an array and therefor is more flexible.

ASSEMBLE_SKELETON.description: Assembles the first skeleton in an assembly.

ASSIGN_VALUE.description: Assigns a value or content of a parameter to another parameter.

AUTHENTICATE.description: Authenticates a user via the password database.

BACKUP_MDL.description: Saves a copy the model to a specific folder.

BEGIN_CATCH_ERROR.description: Runtime errors like invalid references are causing the program to stop with an error message. This command disables the runtime error checking and continues to proceed with the next valid statements. For syntax errors the program will stop in any case.

BEGIN_CONSTRAINT_SET.description: Constraint sets are defined in the following manner:

BEGIN_DEBUG.description: Starts debug mode when processing a tab file. After every line the user has to confirm to go on in a Creo Elements/Pro string menu via Done select or Quit select.

BEGIN_SUBCOMP.description: Starts debug mode when processing a tab file. After every line the user has to confirm to go on in a Creo Elements/Pro string menu via Done select or Quit select.

BEGIN_SUBCOMP_INFO.description: Distinguishes if a component description file is used as a main component or as a sub component. Elements inside BEGIN_SUBCOMP_INFO ... END_SUBCOMP_INFO are only executed in case this component description file is used because of a component description block entry.

BEGIN_TOPELEM_INFO.description: Distinguishes if a component description file is used as a main component or as a sub component. Elements inside BEGIN_TOPELEM_INFO ... END_TOPELEM_INFO are only executed in case this component description file is used as a main component. In case it is executed because of a component description block entry, it will be ignored.

BREAK_MDL_DEPENDENCIES.description: Break dependencies of a model. This helps to remove references to ghost objects. This function requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

BUILD_FILE_NAME.description: Builds the file name from path, name and extension information. This command determines automatically if slashes or backslashes need to be added.

CALC_CLEARANCE.description: Calculates the clearance between two parts similar to Analysis > Model > Pairs Clearance.

CALC_CURVE_EXTREMES.description: Calculates the extreme points of the curves in one direction.

CALC_CURVE_POINT.description: Calculates the point on the curves with has a specific distance in one direction.

CALC_CURVE_POINTS.description: Calculates the points on the curves with have a specific distance in one direction.

CALC_FEATURE_DIFF.description: Compares two models and returns features of the first model which are only available in this model or which are different from the corresponding feature in the second model. By default the comparison of feature is only done by their geometry. Comparison against their dimensions can be included.

CALC_FEATURE_OUTLINE.description: Compares two models and returns features of the first model which are only available in this model or which are different from the corresponding feature in the second model. By default the comparison of feature is only done by their geometry. Comparison against their dimensions can be included.

CALC_FORMULA.description: Calculates a formula by a string expression. Variable used in the formula must be available in SmartAssembly. Otherwise the calculation fails.

CALC_GLOBAL_INTERFERENCE.description: Calculates the global interference of an assembly similar to .

CALC_ORIENTATION.description: Determines the orientation of a curve, a composite curve or an edge related to a direction vector.

CALC_OUTLINE.description: Calculates the outline of a model, including its sub components regarding the specified coordinate system.

CALC_OUTLINE_PARAM.description: Calculates center and size of a model with respect to a coordinate system and stores it in a parameter.

CALC_PARAM_POS.description: Calculates a position on a geometrical reference based on a parametrization between 0 and 1. For edges and curves only one parameter is used. For surfaces two are required.

CALC_POINT_ON_LINE.description: Calculates if a point is located on a line or a segment and its projection point on it.

CALC_RAY_INTERSECTION.description: Calculates the intersected model of a ray. Only visible models are considered. For each model the information about ray intrusion and extrusion is calculated. The output is sorted by the intruding order of the different models.

CALC_SURFACE_SIDE.description: Determines if a reference is located on the positive or negative side of a planar surface. The surface direction is the norm vector of the theoretical projection point.

CALC_TRANSFORM_POINT.description: Calculates the transformation of a point.

CALC_TRANSFORM_VECTOR.description: Calculates the transformation of a vector.

CALC_TRANSFORMATION.description: Calculates the transformation between two models or coordinate systems.

CALL.description: Executes another script file by specifying the file name. The script file execution starts in the assembly description block.

CALL_EX.description: Executes another script file by specifying the file name. The script file execution starts in the assembly description block.

CANCEL_INSERT_MODE.description: Cancels insert mode and resumes the suppressed features.

CAPTION.description: Customizes the caption line of the user dialog.

CHECK_COMMON_FEAT_PARAM.description: Checks if a parameter exists in an array of feature references. The parameter content can optionally be included in the comparison.

CHECK_COMMON_MDL_PARAM.description: Checks if a parameter exists in an array of model references. The parameter content can optionally be included in the comparison.

CHECK_EXTRUDE_OUTLINE.description: Inspects if the sketched contour of an extrude feature exceeds the geometry. This is typically used to test if an extruded cut is completely or partly outside the solid geometry.

CHECKBOX_PARAM.description: Checkbox parameter in graphical user interface. A checkbox parameter provides an option to the user which can be selected or un-selected.

CHECKIN_OBJECT.description: To check-in an object to PDMLink.

CHECKIN_OBJECTS.description: To check-in an object to PDMLink.

CHECKIN_WORKSPACE.description: To check-in the complete workspace in PDMLink. This allows to check-in also non Creo objects.

CHECKOUT_OBJECT.description: To check an object from Intralink or check out / download it from PDMLink.

CHECKOUT_OBJECTS.description: To check-out multiple objects from Intralink or check out / download them from PDMLink.

CHOOSE_FILE.description: Executes file open dialog and lets the user select a file.

CHOOSE_FILES.description: Executes file open dialog and lets the user select multiple files. The files are stored in the array in the order the user selected them.

CHOOSE_PATH.description: Executes path open dialog and lets the user select a path.

CLEAN_BOM_BALLOONS.description: Cleans up the position of BOM balloons for a drawing view. The command is available since Creo 2.0 M050 and above.

CLEANUP_DRW_VIEW_DIMS.description: Cleans up dimensions of a specified drawing view. The function is supported for Creo 2.0 and above.

CLEAR_ARRAY.description: Erases all elements from an array.

CLEAR_GUI_CANCELLED.description: Clears a flagged cancellation of the graphical user interface

CLEAR_MAP.description: Erases all elements from a map.

CLEAR_SELBUFFER.description: Removes all references from the selection buffer.

CLEAR_WORKSPACE.description: Erases all models from the client side and from the server side active workspace.

CONFIG_ELEM.description: Starts graphical user interface and table processing. After the dialog box closes, the program continues with the next line.

CONFIG_HTML.description: Starts the default browser with a prepared web page as an user interface implemented with JavaScript. SmartAssembly implements an internal HTTP server for this command.

CONVERT_DRW_VIEW_DIM_TO_ORDINATE.description: Convert a drawing view dimension to a ordinate dimension.

CONVERT_HOLE_DATA.description: Converts the data from an existing hole to another hole type. This command requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 4 or above.

CONVERT_LEGACY_ANNOTATION.description: Converts a legacy annotation. These annotations have been created prior to Creo 4.0. This function requires Creo Parametric 4.0.

CONVERT_MATRIX_TO_TRANSFORMATION.description: Converts a matrix to a transformation by calculating its Euler Angles.

CONVERT_TO_SMT.description: Converts a solid part to a sheetmetal part by specifying its driving surface and thickness.

CONVERT_TRANSFORMATION_TO_MATRIX.description: Converts a transformation to a matrix.

COPY_COMPONENT.description: Executes the copy functionality of a former created component.

COPY_FILE.description: Copies a file from one location to another in the file system.

COPY_FILE_FROM_WS.description: Copies a file from the current workspace to local hard disk for Intralink 8.0 (and above) / PDMLink.

COPY_FILE_TO_WS.description: Copies a file from the local hard disk to the current workspace for Intralink 8.0 (and above) / PDMLink.

COPY_LAYERS_FROM_MDL.description: Copies layers form another model. This command also works for rule based layers.

COPY_MDL.description: Creates a copy of an existing Creo Elements/Pro model.

COPY_REF.description: Copies content from one existing reference to a new reference name.

CRASH.description: Crashes the current SmartAssembly session and Creo Elements/Pro. Note this command makes only sense for stability tests of the SmartDesignServer and should not be used for productive code.

CREATE_ANNOTATION_PLANE.description: Creates an annotation plane based on model orientation or a plane reference.

CREATE_BOM_BALLOONS.description: Creates BOM balloons for a repeat region. The command is available since Creo 2.0 M050 and above.

CREATE_COMB_VIEW.description: Creates a new combined view. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

CREATE_COPY_GEOMETRY.description: Creates a copy geometry feature. This command requires Creo Elements/Pro Wildfire 4 or above and the AAX module.

CREATE_DIRECTORY.description: Creates a directory in the file system.

CREATE_DRW.description: Creates a new drawing from a drawing template

CREATE_DRW_NOTE_EX.description: Creates a note on a drawing.

CREATE_DRW_SYMBOL.description: Creates a drawing symbol by use of a drawing symbol file.

CREATE_DRW_SYMBOL_EX.description: Creates a drawing symbol by use of a drawing symbol file.

CREATE_DRW_TABLE.description: Creates a new drawing table based on a table template.

CREATE_DRW_VIEW_DETAIL.description: Creates a detailed drawing view regarding an existing one with a specified outline curve. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

CREATE_DRW_VIEW_DETAIL_CIRCLE.description: Creates a detailed drawing view regarding an existing one with a circular outline. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

body: CREATE_DRW_VIEW_DIM ${1:input_drawing_view_ref} ${2:input_INT_num_refs} ${3| ,input_refs_for_dims|} ${4:input_DOUBLE_posX} ${5:input_DOUBLE_posY} ${6| ,DECIMAL_PLACES,ORIENTATION,ATTACH_TYPE_REF1,ATTACH_TYPE_REF2|} ${6/(DECIMAL_PLACES)|(ORIENTATION)|(ATTACH_TYPE_REF1)|(ATTACH_TYPE_REF2)/${1:+INT_num_dec_places}${2:+HORIZONTAL VERTICAL SLANTED ARC_ANGLE ARC_LENGTH}${3:+END1 END2 CENTER MIDPOINT NONE}${4:+END1 END2 CENTER MIDPOINT NONE}/} ${7| ,output_ref_dim|}
CREATE_DRW_VIEW_DIM.description: Creates a drawing dimension in a drawing view according to specified model references and placement position.

CREATE_DRW_VIEW_DIM_ORDINATE_BASELINE.description: Creates a drawing ordinate dimension baseline.

CREATE_DRW_VIEW_GENERAL.description: Creates a general drawing view. The orientation is specified by the a model view.

CREATE_DRW_VIEW_NOTE.description: Creates a drawing note for a specified view. An leader point could be specified for this.

CREATE_DRW_VIEW_PROJECTION.description: Creates a projected drawing view regarding an existing one.

CREATE_DRW_VIEW_SECTION.description: Creates a cross section in a drawing view base on a solid model section. The command requires Wildfire 5.0 and above. Before Creo 2.0 M230 / Creo 3.0 M090 the cross section is shown with area model edge visibility. Afterwards it shows as total model edge visibility.

CREATE_DRW_VIEW_SYMBOL.description: Creates a drawing symbol for a specific view by use of a drawing symbol file.

CREATE_DRW_VIEW_SYMBOL_EX.description: Creates a drawing symbol for a specific view by use of a drawing symbol file.

CREATE_EXPLODE_STATE.description: Creates an explode state in an assembly. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

CREATE_FEAT_PARAM.description: Creates a Creo Elements/Pro feature or component parameter. In case of a double parameter, the unit can be specified.

CREATE_FEATURE_RELATION.description: Creates a Creo Elements/Pro feature relation.

CREATE_GENERAL_POINT.description: Creates a general point datum feature which can contain different points.

CREATE_GTOL.description: Creates a geometric tolerance in solids or drawings. This command requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 or above.

CREATE_GTOL_CREO4.description: Creates a geometric tolerance in solids or drawings with the new functionality in Creo 4.0 and above. This command requires Creo 4.0 or above.

CREATE_HOLE.description: Creates a hole feature. This command requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 4 or above.

CREATE_IDENTIFIER.description: Creates a new component engine identifier and stores the result in a variable.

CREATE_INHERITANCE.description: Creates an inheritance feature based on references to target and source part.

CREATE_JOINT.description: Creates a joint condition for an offset coordinate system which is driven by 3 length and 3 angle dimensions and refers to a parent coordinate system. The dimensions of this coordinate system are always updated to match another coordinate system.

CREATE_LAYER.description: Creates a new layer in a model.

CREATE_LAYER_STATE.description: Creates a layer state in a solid model. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

CREATE_MDL_PARAM.description: Creates a model parameter. In case of a double parameter, the unit can be specified.

CREATE_NOTE.description: Creates a text note with leader to a model or feature. As attachment item a point reference is required.

CREATE_NOTE_EX.description: Creates a note in a solid model.

CREATE_ORIENTATION.description: Creates orientation of parts and assemblies and saves it as a view.

CREATE_ORIENTATION_MATRIX.description: Creates orientation by matrix and saves it as a view.

CREATE_POINTS.description: Creates a datum point offset coordinate system feature with several points inside.

CREATE_POINTS_EX.description: Creates a datum point offset coordinate system feature with several points inside.

CREATE_PUBLISHED_GEOMETRY.description: Creates a published geometry feature. This command requires Creo Elements/Pro Wildfire 4 or above and the AAX module.

CREATE_REF_PATTERN.description: Creates reference patterns of features and components.

CREATE_RELATION.description: Creates a Creo Elements/Pro model relation.

CREATE_SHRINKWRAP.description: Creates a shrink wrap feature. This command requires Creo Elements/Pro Wildfire 4 or above and the AAX module.

CREATE_SIMPREP.description: Creates a new simplified representation of a model. This works for parts and assemblies.

CREATE_SURFFINISH.description: Creates a surface finish in a solid model.

CREATE_SYMBOL.description: Creates a symbol in a solid model.

CREATE_UDF.description: Creates a user-defined feature with specified references and variable dimensions.

CREATE_UNIQUE_STRING.description: Creates a globally unique string with 32 characters from the operating system.

CREATE_UNIT_SYSTEM.description: Creates a new unit system in a model

CREATE_WORKSPACE.description: Creates a workspace for the active PDMLink server.

CREATE_XSEC.description: Creates a planar cross section based on a reference to a datum plane.

CREATE_XSEC_EX.description: Creates a planar cross section based on a reference to a datum plane, coordinate system or coordinate system axis and define the intersected models. This command is only available for Creo 2.0 and above.

DDM_CHECKOUT_OBJECT.description: Checks out an object from the PDM system DDM.

DEACTIVATE_SERVER.description: Deactivates the current PDMLink server connection.

DEACTIVATE_XSEC.description: Deactivates the cross sections of the current model.

DECLARE_ARRAY.description: Declares an variable for storing variables.

DECLARE_MAP.description: Declares a variable for storing variables by a key name.

DECLARE_MDL_NOTEBOOK.description: Declares a solid model to a notebook.

DECLARE_REFERENCE.description: Declaration of a new reference variable. A standard value could be specified.

DECLARE_STOPWATCH.description: Declares a stopwatch variable for measuring elapsed time.

DECLARE_STRUCT.description: Declaration of a new structure variable.

DECLARE_VARIABLE.description: Declaration of a new variable. A standard value could be specified.

DELETE_ANNOTATION_ELEMENTS.description: Delete all elements from an annotation feature.

DELETE_ARRAY_ELEM.description: Deletes an element from the array specified by the index number.

DELETE_COMB_VIEW.description: Deletes an existing combined view of a model. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

DELETE_COMPONENT.description: Executes the delete functionality of a former created component.

DELETE_DRW_MDL.description: Deletes a model from a drawing.

DELETE_DRW_MDL_SIMPREP.description: Deletes a simplified representation from a drawing. This commend work identical to in the drawing mode.

DELETE_DRW_VIEW.description: Delete a view from a drawing.

DELETE_DRW_VIEW_DIM.description: Deletes a drawing dimension which was created or shown on the drawing.

DELETE_EXTERNAL_DATA.description: Deletes external data by keyword from a model.

DELETE_FAMINSTANCE.description: Deletes an existing instances from a family table.

DELETE_FAMITEM.description: Deletes family table item from a family table of the specified generic.

DELETE_FAMTABLE.description: Deletes a complete family table of a generic model.

DELETE_FEAT_PARAM.description: Deletes an existing Creo Elements/Pro feature or component parameter.

DELETE_FILE.description: Deletes a file from the file system.

DELETE_GTOL.description: Deletes a geometric tolerance from a solids or a drawing. This command requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 or above.

DELETE_MAP_ELEM.description: Deletes an element from the specified by its name.

DELETE_MATERIAL.description: Deletes the currently assigned or the specified materials from a model.

DELETE_ORIENTATION.description: Deletes one or many orientations from a solid model. This command is available since Creo 3.0 M140 / Creo 4.0 M020 and above.

DELETE_PRO_PROGRAM_INPUT.description: Delete the complete input section information of Pro/PROGRAM from a model.

DELETE_REF_PARAM.description: Deletes an existing reference parameter. This can be used to delete parameters from annotation elements, surfaces, quilts, edges, curves and composite curves.

DELETE_WORKSPACE.description: Delete a workspace for the active PDMLink server.

DELETE_XSEC.description: Deletes cross sections from a solid model. This command is only available for Creo 2.0 and above.

DESIGNATE_ATTRIBUTE.description: Designates a dimension, geometric tolerance surface or surface finish symbol.

DESIGNATE_FEAT_PARAM.description: Designates feature or component feature parameters.

DISP_LIST_ADD_LINE.description: Adds a new line to the display list for a specific model. Display lists are not stored to the model. When the model is opened in another window the display list will not show up.

DISP_LIST_UPDATE.description: Updates the display list of a model.

DISPLAY_ANNOTATIONS.description: Toggles the display of annotations on or off.

DISPLAY_COMB_VIEWS.description: Toggles the display of combined views on or off.

DISPLAY_DATUM.description: Toggles the display of datum planes, coordinate systems, axes, points and their tags on or off.

DISPLAY_XSEC.description: Sets the visibility status of a cross section of the current model.

DRAG_COMP_POS.description: Allows to place a component dynamically. Click to left mouse button to drop it.

ENABLE_CONT_REF_CHECKING_MODE.description: Determines if a continuous checking for the validity of all references should take place after each traversed line of the program file. Especially if many models are in session, this could have effect on the performance. The default setting is determined by the configuration option .

ENABLE_DATA_CAPTURE_MODE.description: Determines if Creo Elements/Pro parameters for modification should be created or not. By default these parameters are created. In case of disabling this mode, modification and access to existing components is disabled. In return processing time is faster.

ENABLE_LOG_MESSAGE.description: Enables or disables the message logging mode.

ENABLE_PRINT_MESSAGE.description: Enables or disables the output of the command.

ENABLE_RESOLVE_MODE.description: Determines if Creo should show up the resolved mode (panic window) in case of regeneration problems. This command overwrites the option for the execution of the tab file.

ENABLE_RESTORE_SIMPREPS.description: Determines if after each processed code line the simplified representations of the solid models in session should be restored. This is useful especially when switching to drawing with simplified representations. The default setting is determined by the configuration option RESTORE_SIMPREPS.

ENABLE_SAVE_DRAWINGS.description: Determines if drawings should be saved after the execution of a tab file. This command overwrites the option for the execution of the tab file.

END_CATCH_ERROR.description: This command terminates an mode and switches back to normal runtime error handling.

END_DEBUG.description: Terminates the debug mode started with BEGIN_DEBUG.

ERASE_ALL_POST.description: Erases all the models after the tab file was processed.

ERASE_DRW_DIM_WITNESS_LINE.description: Erases the witness line of a drawing dimension on the specified end. This function requires Creo 2.0 M160 / Creo 3.0 M040 or above.

ERASE_FAMINSTANCES.description: Erases all family instances from a generic model in Creo Elements/Pro.

ERASE_MDL.description: Erases a model from Creo Elements/Pro.

ERASE_NOT_DISPLAYED.description: Erases models which are not displayed from Creo Parametric by using a mapkey. Same functionality as the Creo Parametric menu sequence: .

ERASE_NOT_DISPLAYED_EX.description: Erases models which are not displayed from Creo Parametric by a Creo/TOOLKIT command. This has slightly other side effects than which works by using a mapkey.

body: $[![(eva)$[![{type a math expression (e.g. 1+1) and hit TAB}]!]]!]

EXCEL_ACTIVATE_DOCUMENT.description: Activates a specific document in excel. The document must already be loaded. This functionality is used to switch between different documents for reading and writing.

EXCEL_ACTIVATE_SHEET.description: Activates a specific data sheet of the active document in Excel.

EXCEL_CLEAR_BUFFER.description: Clears the data of the Excel read/write buffer.

EXCEL_CLEAR_CONTENT.description: Clears the content of one Excel cell or of a range of cells

EXCEL_CLOSE_DOCUMENT.description: Closes the active document in Excel.

body: EXCEL_GET_STRINGS CELL_BY_INDEX rmin 0 CELL_BY_INDEX rmax 0 part_names_arrays

EXCEL_CONNECT.description: Establishes a connection to Microsoft Excel. In case Excel is not already running, it will be launched. Otherwise a connection to the already running Excel program is established.

EXCEL_CREATE_SHEET.description: Creates a new sheet in the active document in Excel. In case the sheet already exists, it activates the existing sheet.

EXCEL_DISCONNECT.description: Terminates a connection to Microsoft Excel.

EXCEL_DISPLAY_ALERTS.description: Enables or disables Excel alerts. By default the alters are disabled.

EXCEL_ENABLE_MACROS.description: Enables or disables Excel alerts. By default the alters are disabled.

EXCEL_GET_ACTIVE_RANGE.description: Determines the active range of a document. This is the smallest block which contains all cells with a value in the active sheet.

EXCEL_GET_ACTIVE_SHEET.description: Determines the index of the active sheet of the active document in Excel.

EXCEL_GET_CELL_BY_NAME.description: Retrieves the row and column index based on the cell name.

EXCEL_GET_DOCUMENT_NAME.description: Retrieves the name of the active excel document.

EXCEL_GET_DOCUMENT_READONLY.description: Retrieves the information if the document is opened read-only.

EXCEL_GET_FILE_EXTENSION.description: Evaluates if the currently connected Microsoft Excel is using as file extension.

EXCEL_GET_SELECTION.description: Assigns the content of a currently selected Excel cells to an array. For each selected cell a consisting on row and column index and the content of the cell is appended.

EXCEL_GET_SHEET_NAME.description: Retrieves the name of the specified sheet of the active excel document.

EXCEL_GET_SHEET_NAMES.description: Retrieves the name of all sheets of the excel document.

EXCEL_GET_STRING.description: Retrieves a string of the specified row and column in Excel and stores to a .

EXCEL_GET_STRING_BUFFER.description: Retrieves a string from the Excel read/write buffer. This command allows to read data from Excel with high performance.

EXCEL_GET_STRINGS.description: Retrieves the strings from multiple excel cells and stores in to an describing row, column and value. Use this function to retrieve the cell text as it shows up in Excel.

EXCEL_GET_VALUE.description: Retrieves a value of the specified row and column in Excel and stores to a .

EXCEL_GET_VALUE_BUFFER.description: Retrieves a value from the Excel read/write buffer. This command allows to read data from Excel with high performance.

EXCEL_GET_VALUES.description: Retrieves the content from multiple excel cells and stores in to an describing row, column and value.

EXCEL_LOAD_DOCUMENT.description: Retrieves a new Excel document specified by the name. The document could be located either in library or in working directory.

EXCEL_RUN_MACRO.description: Executes a Macro in the current Excel document.

EXCEL_SAVE_DOCUMENT.description: Saves a Excel document specified by the name. The document could be located either in library or in working directory.

EXCEL_SET_VALUE.description: Retrieves a values and assigns it to an Excel cell.

EXCEL_SET_VALUE_BUFFER.description: Writes a value to the Excel read/write buffer. This command allows to write data from Excel with high performance.

EXCEL_SET_VALUES.description: Assigns the content of a complete describing row, column and value.

EXCEL_START.description: Starts a new connection to Microsoft Excel.

EXCEL_UPDATE_BUFFER.description: Synchronizes the Excel read/write buffer with the active sheet. This command is used to allow buffered read/write access to Excel data with higher performance.

EXCLUDE_FROM_SIMPREP.description: Exclude component from simplified representation. This works only for assemblies, but not for parts.

EXEC_MDLCHECK.description: Performs a ModelCHECK analysis similar to .

EXIT.description: Exist stops the execution of the current script file without causing an error. This option could be used for debugging techniques.

EXPLODE_DRW_VIEW.description: Activates or deactivates the default explosion state in a drawing view. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

EXPORT_DRW_PDF.description: Exports a drawing sheet to a PDF file. This command is available for Wildfire 3 and above.

EXPORT_FEMMESH.description: Exports a finite element mesh. This command requires a material with density to be assigned on the model. Additionally since Wildfire 4 you need to make sure Creo Elements/Pro MECHANICA is installed. The Creo Elements/Pro Pro/MESH licenses is required for this command.

EXPORT_NC_TOOL_XML.description: Exports a NC tool definition to a XML file.

EXPORT_PDF.description: Exports PDFs from parts, assemblies and drawings. This command is available for Wildfire 4 and above.

EXPORT_PRO_PROGRAM.description: Exports the Pro/PROGRAM information of a model like .

EXPORT_TBLPATTERN_DATA.description: Exports table pattern data which was already retrieved in an array in the Creo Elements/Pro table file format.

FILE_CLOSE.description: Closes a file which was opened.

body: !   TEST WHETHER SOMETHING IS A FILE HANDLE AND WHETHER STILL OPEN
FILE_HANDLE_VALID_SNIPPET.description: Checks whether a variable is a file handle and whether it is open/valid and can be written to.

FILE_OPEN.description: Opens a file for reading or writing.

FILE_OPEN_DIALOG.description: Executes the Creo Elements/Pro file open dialog and lets the user select a file. This allows also access to connected PDMLink or Intralink sessions as well as to files in session.

FILE_READ.description: Reads the complete content of an open file.

FILE_READ_LINE.description: Reads a line from an open file.

FILE_REPLACE_LINE.description: Replaces a line of an existing file.

FILE_SAVE_DIALOG.description: Opens the Creo Parametric file save dialog and lets the user specify a file name and location. This allows also access to connected PDMLink or Intralink sessions.

FILE_SET_POS.description: Sets the file descriptor to a specific line.

FILE_WRITE.description: Writes the content of a string variable to an open file.

FILE_WRITE_LINE.description: Writes a line to an open file.

FIND_ARRAY_ELEM.description: Searches for an element in an array and returns the array index or -1 in case it was not found.

body: ! FIND VALID SURFACE POINTS USING LOOP
CALC_PARAM_POS first_csys a_shrink_surf U V shrink_surf_pos
GET_SURFACES_AT_POS PRECISION 0.2  first_csys  surfs_from_shrink shrink_surf_pos shrink_surfs_check
GET_SURFACES_AT_POS PRECISION 0.2  first_csys  all_surfaces shrink_surf_pos select_surfs
! GET_SURFACES_AT_POS PRECISION 0.2  first_csys  all_surfaces shrink_surf_pos select_surfs

FOR.description: Processes a loop over a code sequence for several references which are detected because of the specified option.

FTP_DOWNLOAD_FILE.description: To download a file from the connected FTP server.

FTP_UPLOAD_FILE.description: To upload a file to the connected FTP server.

GENERATE_RANDOM_INT.description: Generates a random integer between an upper and a lower limit based on the Mersenne Twister algorithm.

GET_ACCURACY.description: Reads the accuracy of a model.

GET_ACTIVE_COMB_VIEW.description: Retrieves the name of the active combined view. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

GET_ACTIVE_LAYER_STATE.description: Detects the active layer state. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

GET_ACTIVE_NC_OPERATION.description: Gets the currently active NC operation from a NC assembly.

GET_ACTIVE_SIMPREP.description: Retrieves information about the active simplified representation of a model.

GET_ANNOTATION_ELEMENT.description: Retrieves the first element of an annotation feature.

GET_ANNOTATION_ELEMENT_NAME.description: Gets the name of a specified annotation element which is contained by an annotation feature.

GET_ANNOTATION_ELEMENTS.description: Retrieves all elements of an annotation feature.

GET_ANNOTATION_ENVELOPE.description: Calculates the envelope of a dimension, note, symbol, geometric tolerance or surface finish annotation. This function requires Creo Parametric 4.0 M190,  6.0.5.0, 7.0.1.0 or above.

GET_ANNOTATION_LEADER_REF.description: Retrieves the attachment reference of an annotation leader.

GET_ANNOTATION_LEADER_REFS.description: Retrieves the all attachment references of an annotation leader.

GET_ANNOTATION_LEGACY_STATE.description: Retrieves the information about the legacy state of an annotation. These annotations have been created prior to Creo 4.0. This function requires Creo Parametric 4.0 M090, 5.0.5.0, 6.0.2.0 or above.

GET_ANNOTATION_PLANES.description: Retrieves several annotation plane references by name. The command is available since Creo 4.0 M130, Creo 6.0.5.0, Creo 7.0.0.0 and above.

GET_ANNOTATION_TEXT_STYLE.description: Retrieves the text style of an annotation.

GET_ARC_DATA.description: Retrieves the shape information of an arc edge or a curve.

GET_ARRAY_ELEM.description: Retrieves a specific element of an .

GET_ARRAY_SIZE.description: Determines number of elements in an .

GET_ATTRIBUTE_DESIGNATION_STATUS.description: Inquiries if a dimension, geometrical tolerance or surface finish is designated.

GET_AUDIT_TRAIL.description: Retrieves the history information for a model provided by .

GET_AUTHENTICATION.description: Retrieves login and password information from the password database See in the User Guide for more information.

GET_AXIS_DATA.description: Retrieves origin and direction of an axis.

GET_BACKGROUND_VIEW.description: Retrieves the background view of a drawing sheet.

GET_BREAKABLE_MDL_DEPENDENCY_STATE.description: Retrieves the installation if a model has breakable dependencies. This helps to detect ghost objects. This function requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

GET_BROWSER_SIZE.description: Retrieves the size of the Creo embedded browser in percentage of coverage of the Creo window. The values in the range 0.0 to 100.0.

GET_COL_ARRAY.description: Retrieves a specified column of an array with sub-arrays to get an array with plain elements. This is similar to receiving a column vector from a matrix.

GET_COLOR.description: Gets rgb color of assembly, part, feature, curve or surface as of red, green and blue between 0 and 255.

GET_COLOR_PROPS.description: Gets the color properties of assemblies, parts, features, curves or surfaces.

GET_COLOR_PROPS_ASSIGNED.description: Determines if a color is assigned.

GET_COMB_VIEW_ANNOTATION_VISIBILITY.description: Retrieves the visibility state of an annotation in a combined view. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

GET_COMB_VIEW_ANNOTATIONS.description: Retrieves the annotations of a combined view. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

GET_COMB_VIEW_PROPS.description: Retrieves the properties of a combined view. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

GET_COMB_VIEWS.description: Retrieves all combined views of a model. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

GET_COMMON_NAME.description: Retrieves the content of the parameter of the model. This command requires Creo Elements/Pro Wildfire 4 or above.

GET_COMP_BOM_LEVEL.description: Retrieves nesting level in the model tree of a component.

GET_COMP_PLACED.description: Determines the placement state of a component. Unplaced component are usually created via .

GET_COMP_TYPE.description: Retrieves the type of a component.

GET_COMPCURVE_CURVES.description: Retrieves an array of curves from one composite curve.

GET_CONFIG_HTML_DATA.description: Retrieves the data submitted by the web page called from .

GET_CONFIG_OPTION.description: Retrieves the current setting of a Creo Elements/Pro configuration option and stores it to a variable as string value.

GET_CONSEC_FEAT_PARAM_INDEX.description: Gets the next available index for a new consecutive parameter on feature or component feature level.

GET_CONSEC_MDL_PARAM_INDEX.description: Gets the next available index for a new consecutive parameter on part or assembly level.

GET_CONSTRAINT.description: Retrieve a constraint from a component.

GET_CONSTRAINT_SET.description: Retrieve a constraint sets from a component.

GET_CONSTRAINT_SETS.description: Retrieves all constraint sets from a component.

GET_CONSTRAINTS.description: Retrieves all constrains from a component.

GET_CSYS_VECTOR.description: Retrieves a direction vector from a coordinate system.

GET_CURRENT_MDL.description: Retrieves the reference of the current model.

GET_CURRENT_WORKSPACE.description: Determines the name of the current workspace from the connected Intralink or PDMLink session. In case no workspace is available, the results is an empty string.

GET_CURVE_AT_POS.description: Determines the curve among an array of curves which contains the specified position.

GET_CURVE_COMPCURVE.description: Searches the composite curve which contains the specified curve.

GET_CURVE_LENGTH.description: Computes the length of a curve or a composite curve based on optional start and end references.

GET_CURVE_PNT_RATIO.description: Computes the ratio of the selection position on a curve. This could be used for example to calculate the ratio for a point on curve UDF based on the selection of the user.

GET_CURVE_TYPE.description: Gets type of a curve or composite curve

GET_CURVES_AT_POS.description: Determines the curves among an array of curves which contains the specified position.

GET_DATUM_TAG_ATTACHMENT.description: Retrieves the reference to the attachment of the datum tag.

GET_DATUM_TAG_LABEL.description: Retrieves the label of a datum tag. For the new Creo 4.0 datum tags this is the label for legacy datum tags it is the name of the related datum plane.

GET_DENSITY.description: Retrieves the current density of a part. In case no density is specified 1 is used as default.

GET_DESIGN_SERVER_VARIABLE.description: Retrieves a variable provided by the for the current job.

GET_DIM_DECIMALS.description: Reads the number of decimal places of a dimension.

GET_DIM_DISPLAY_ROUNDED.description: Retrieves the information if the dimension is displayed as a rounded value. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

GET_DIM_DISPLAY_ROUNDED_ACCESSIBLE.description: Retrieves the information if the of the dimension properties is accessible. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

GET_DIM_DISPLAY_TYPE.description: Retrieves the display type of a dimension.

GET_DIM_FEATURE.description: Retrieves the feature which owns the dimension.

GET_DIM_FRACTIONAL.description: Retrieves the information if a solid dimension is shown in fractional format.

GET_DIM_MDL.description: Retrieves the model which owns the dimension.

GET_DIM_OVERRIDE_VALUE.description: Reads the dimension override value from a created dimension.

GET_DIM_SETUP_TYPE.description: Retrieves the setup type of a dimension.

GET_DIM_SYMBOL.description: Reads the symbol from a specified dimension.

GET_DIM_TEXT.description: Read the text from a specified dimension.

GET_DIM_TOL.description: Reads the upper and lower limit from a tolerance of a dimension.

GET_DIM_TOL_TABLE.description: Retrieves the tolerance table of a dimension.

GET_DIM_TOL_TYPE.description: Retrieves the tolerance type of a dimension.

GET_DIM_TYPE.description: Retrieves the type of a dimension.

GET_DIM_VALUE.description: Read the value from a specified dimension.

GET_DIM_VALUE_DISPLAY_TYPE.description: Reads the value display type for a created dimension.

GET_DRF_CSYS_DEFINED.description: Retrieves the information if a coordinate system is defined for a datum reference frame.

GET_DRW_ANNOTATION_POS.description: Retrieves the position of an annotation on a drawing.

GET_DRW_ANNOTATION_TEXT_STYLE.description: Retrieves the text style of a drawing annotation.

GET_DRW_ANNOTATION_VISIBILITY.description: Determines if a drawing annotation is visible.

GET_DRW_CUR_SHEET.description: Retrieves the number of the current drawing sheet.

GET_DRW_DIM_ATTACHED.description: Retrieves the information about the attachment status of a drawing dimension. Unattached dimensions are displayed in magenta color. This function requires the .

GET_DRW_DIM_POS.description: Retrieves the position of a drawing dimension.

GET_DRW_DIM_TEXT_ANGLE.description: Retrieves the angle of the drawing dimension text.

GET_DRW_DIM_TEXT_POS.description: Retrieves the position of a drawing dimension text.

GET_DRW_FORMAT.description: Retrieves the name of drawing format.

GET_DRW_FORMAT_TABLES.description: Retrieves all tables of the current drawing format.

GET_DRW_ITEM_STATE.description: Determines the display state of a drawing item.

GET_DRW_MDL.description: Retrieves the active model of a drawing.

GET_DRW_MDLS.description: Retrieves an array of all models from a drawing.

GET_DRW_NOTE_ANGLE.description: Retrieves the angle of a drawing note.

GET_DRW_NOTE_OWNER.description: Retrieves information about the owner of a note. This can be a table, a cross section or the drawing.

GET_DRW_NOTE_POS.description: Retrieves the position of a drawing note.

GET_DRW_NOTE_TEXT.description: Retrieves the text from an existing drawing note.

GET_DRW_NOTE_TEXT_ALIGNMENT.description: Retrieves the horizontal and vertical alignment from an existing drawing note.

GET_DRW_NOTE_TEXT_FONT.description: Retrieves the text font from an existing drawing note.

GET_DRW_NOTE_TEXT_HEIGHT.description: Retrieves the text height from an existing drawing note.

GET_DRW_OPTIONS.description: Reads the current options of a drawing.

GET_DRW_REF_VIEW.description: Retrieves the reference of a drawing view from an existing reference.

GET_DRW_SCALE.description: Retrieves the scale of drawing view or of drawing.

GET_DRW_SHEET_NAME.description: Retrieves the name of a sheet from a drawing.

GET_DRW_SHEET_NUM.description: Retrieves the number of sheets in a drawing.

GET_DRW_SIZE.description: Retrieves the size of a drawing by name, width and height.

GET_DRW_SYMBOL_GROUP_EXCLUSIVE.description: Examines if a symbol group is exclusive or independent.

GET_DRW_SYMBOL_GROUP_SHOWN.description: Examines if a symbol group is visible or not.

GET_DRW_SYMBOL_NAME.description: Retrieves the name of a drawing symbol.

GET_DRW_SYMBOL_POS.description: Retrieves the position of a drawing symbol.

GET_DRW_TABLE.description: Searches for a drawing table according its position.

GET_DRW_TABLE_CELL_REGION.description: Retrieves the region id for a specific drawing table cell. The command is available since Creo 3.0 M130 / Creo 4.0 M020 and above.

GET_DRW_TABLE_FORMAT.description: Retrieves formatting information from a table cell on a drawing.

GET_DRW_TABLE_FROM_ID.description: Retrieves the drawing table reference based on the drawing reference and the table id.

GET_DRW_TABLE_GROWTH_DIR.description: Determines the growth direction of a drawing table.

GET_DRW_TABLE_ID.description: Retrieves the ID from a drawing table reference.

GET_DRW_TABLE_NOTE.description: Retrieves the note of a drawing table cell.

GET_DRW_TABLE_OUTLINE.description: Retrieves the outline of a table.

GET_DRW_TABLE_POS.description: Retrieves the position of the drawing table. The position is the upper left corner of the first segment.

GET_DRW_TABLE_SHEET.description: Determines the sheet number of a drawing table. The first drawing sheet has the number 1. In case of several table segments the sheet number of the first one is determined.

GET_DRW_TABLE_SIZE.description: Retrieves the number of rows and columns from a drawing table.

GET_DRW_TABLE_TEXT.description: Retrieves text from a drawing table.

GET_DRW_VIEW_AXIS.description: Retrieves the reference to a drawing view axis from an axis of the solid model. This is only possible if the drawing axis was already displayed via the in Creo Elements/Pro.

GET_DRW_VIEW_DIM_METHOD.description: Provides information if the dimension is shown on the drawing or if it was created.

GET_DRW_VIEW_DIM_REFS.description: Retrieves the references of a dimension which was created in the drawing.

GET_DRW_VIEW_DISPLAY.description: Retrieves the display status of an existing drawing view.

GET_DRW_VIEW_MATRIX.description: Retrieves the orientation of a drawing view and calculates a matrix for this.

GET_DRW_VIEW_MDL.description: Retrieves reference to the model of the drawing view. This command is useful for .

GET_DRW_VIEW_NAME.description: Reads the name of a drawing view.

GET_DRW_VIEW_NORM_SURFACES.description: Searches for planar solid surfaces in a drawing view which are directed towards the drawing area.

GET_DRW_VIEW_ORIENTATION.description: Determines the name of the orientation of the solid model which fits to the drawing view.

GET_DRW_VIEW_OUTLINE.description: Calculates the outline of a drawing view.

GET_DRW_VIEW_PNT_COORD.description: Calculates the coordinates of a point with respect to a drawing view.

GET_DRW_VIEW_PNT_ORIENT.description: Determines the orientation of a point concerning a coordinate system in the drawing view. The result is calculated in model coordinates. This function can be used to determine on which side a point is located in the drawing view and if it is before or behind the drawing sheet.

GET_DRW_VIEW_POS.description: Determines the position of a view on a drawing

GET_DRW_VIEW_REF_POS.description: Retrieves the position of a geometrical reference. If the reference was selected the pick position of the mouse is supplied. Otherwise the center position is calculated.

GET_DRW_VIEW_SIMPREP.description: Retrieves the name of the simplified representation which is used in the drawing view. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

GET_DRW_VIEW_STATE.description: Determines the suppress status of a drawing view. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

GET_DRW_VIEW_TYPE.description: Retrieves the type of a drawing view. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

GET_EDGE_AT_POS.description: Determines the edge among an array of edges which contains the specified position.

GET_EDGE_LENGTH.description: Computes the length of an edge based on optional start and end references.

GET_EDGE_PNT_RATIO.description: Computes the ratio of the selection position on an edge. This could be used for example to calculate the ratio for a point on edge UDF based on the selection of the user.

GET_EDGE_SURFACES.description: Retrieves the two neighbour surfaces of an edge.

GET_EDGES_AT_POS.description: Determines the edges among an array of edges which contains the specified position.

GET_ENUMERATED_FEAT_PARAM_VALUES.description: Retrieves all values for a restricted enumerated feature parameter.

GET_ENUMERATED_MDL_PARAM_VALUES.description: Retrieves all values for a restricted enumerated model parameter.

GET_ENUMERATED_REF_PARAM_VALUES.description: Retrieves all values for a restricted enumerated reference parameter.

GET_ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE.description: Retrieves the content of an environment variable.

GET_EXTERNAL_DATA_CLASSES.description: Gets the names of all external data classes which are stored in a model.

GET_EXTERNAL_DATA_SLOTS.description: Get the names of all slots of a specified external data class which are stored in a model.

GET_FAMINSTANCE_NAMES.description: Retrieve an array of all family table instance names.

GET_FAMITEM_NAME.description: Retrieves the name of a family table item.

GET_FAMITEM_STATE.description: Retrieves the state of a family table item for a specific instance and stores it to a variable of type string parameter.

GET_FAMITEM_SYMBOL.description: Retrieves the symbol of a family table item.

GET_FAMITEM_TYPE.description: Retrieves the type of a family table item.

GET_FAMITEM_VALUE.description: Retrieve the value of a family table item for a specific instance and stores it to a variable of type parameter.

GET_FAMITEMS.description: Collects all family table items of a generic model.

GET_FEAT_PARAM_DESCRIPTION.description: Collects all family table items of a generic model.

GET_FEAT_PARAM_DESIGNATION_STATUS.description: Inquiries a Pro/ENGINEER feature or component parameter whether it is designated.

GET_FEAT_PARAM_LOCK_STATUS.description: Reads the lock status of a Creo feature parameter.

GET_FEATURE_DEPENDENCY.description: Retrieves the dependency setting of a copy geom feature.

GET_FEATURE_DEPENDENCY_NAME.description: Retrieves the name of the associated source model to a copy geom feature.

GET_FEATURE_DIMS.description: Retrieves the dimensions of a feature.

GET_FEATURE_FROM_GEOM.description: Retrieves reference to a feature based on the specified reference to a geometrical element (for example an edge, an axis etc.)

GET_FEATURE_NAME.description: Gets name of a specified feature.

GET_FEATURE_NUMBER.description: Retrieves the feature number as shown in the model tree.

GET_FEATURE_SKETCH_DIMS_WITH_REFS.description: Retrieves dimension reference information from sketched features which are supported by Creo Toolkit.

GET_FEATURE_STATE.description: Determines if a feature is suppressed or resumed.

GET_FEATURE_STATE_EX.description: Determines the state of a feature.

GET_FEATURE_SUBTYPE_NAME.description: Retrieves the subtype name of a feature as it shows up in the model tree in the row Feat Subtype.

GET_FEATURE_TYPE_NAME.description: Retrieves the type name of a feature as it shows up in the model tree in the row Feat Type.

GET_FEATURE_UPDATE_NOTIFICATION.description: Retrieves the update notification status of a copy geometry feature. This command requires Creo 3.0 or above. In case the Creo license option .

GET_FILE_SIZE.description: Determines the size of a file.

GET_FLEXIBLE.description: Determines if a component is flexible. The function requires Creo 1.0 or above.

GET_FLEXIBLE_PREDEFINED.description: Determines if a model as predefined varied items for flexibility. This function requires Creo 1.0 or above.

GET_GENERAL_MERGE_FEATURE.description: Accesses a specific feature of a general merge model.

GET_GENERAL_MERGE_FEATURE_NUM.description: Retrieves the number of features in a general merge model.

GET_GEOM_FROM_FEATURE.description: Retrieves a geometry reference from a feature reference of the specified type.

GET_GEOMS_FROM_FEATURE.description: Retrieves all geometry references from a feature reference of the specified type.

GET_GROUP_FEATURE.description: Supplies reference to a specific feature of a group.

GET_GROUP_FEATURE_NUM.description: Retrieves number of features in a group.

GET_GROUP_HEAD.description: Retrieves the immediate or top-level head of a group member.

GET_GTOL_TEXT.description: Reads the text of a geometric tolerance definition of solids or drawings. This command requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 or above.

GET_IDENTIFIER.description: Gets the current session identifier and stores the result to a variable.

GET_IDENTIFIER_FROM_REF.description: Retrieves a component engine identifier and stores the result in a variable.

GET_INSERT_MODE_POSITION.description: In case a model is in insert mode, this commands supplies a reference to the last active feature.

GET_INTENT_MEMBERS.description: Retrieves the references of all members which belong to an intent edge or surface.

GET_LAYER_ITEMS.description: Collects all items from a layer and stores them in an array.

GET_LAYER_STATE_HIDDEN_REFS.description: Retrieves all references which are hidden by a distinct layer state. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

GET_LAYER_STATE_LAYER_STATUS.description: Retrieves the layer visibility information in a layer state. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

GET_LAYER_STATE_LAYERS.description: Retrieves the names of all layers in a layer state. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

GET_LAYER_STATES.description: Retrieves the names of the layer states of a solid model. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

GET_LAYER_STATUS_EX.description: Retrieves the layer visibility information. Extended version of to show more visibility states.

GET_LINE_DATA.description: Retrieves the shape information from a linear edge or a curve.

GET_MAP_SIZE.description: Determines number of elements in a .

GET_MASS_PROPERTIES.description: Calculates the mass properties of a part or assembly similar to . In case the coordinate system is from another model, a temporary one will be created for the measurement.

GET_MATERIAL.description: Reads the assigned material of a model. In case no material is assigned the result is an empty string.

GET_MATERIAL_PROPERTIES.description: Reads the standard properties of the assigned material of a model.

GET_MATERIAL_PROPERTY.description: Read a property of the assigned material of a model. This allows also to access custom material properties.

GET_MATERIALS.description: Searches for the materials which are stored at a model.

GET_MDL_ANNOTATION_PLANE.description: Retrieves the standard annotation plane of each model. Custom named annotation plane could not be processed.

GET_MDL_DIMS.description: Retrieves the dimensions of a model.

GET_MDL_DTL_OPTION.description: Retrieve a specific detail option from a solid model.

GET_MDL_DTL_OPTIONS.description: Retrieves the detail options from a solid model.

GET_MDL_EXTENSION.description: Retrieves the file extension of a model.

GET_MDL_FAILURE_FLAG.description: Inspects if the model contains any failed feature. In case the Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 4 or below, the result is always false.

GET_MDL_MODIFIED.description: Determines if the modification flag of a model is set. This modification flag decides if the model has to be saved.

GET_MDL_NAME.description: Retrieves name of a specified model.

GET_MDL_NOTEBOOK.description: Retrieves the declare notebook of a solid model.

GET_MDL_NOTEBOOKS.description: Retrieves all declared notebooks of a solid model.

GET_MDL_PARAM_DESCRIPTION.description: Retrieves all declared notebooks of a solid model.

GET_MDL_PARAM_DESIGNATION_STATUS.description: Inquiries a Pro/ENGINEER parameter whether it is designated.

GET_MDL_PARAM_LOCK_STATUS.description: Reads the lock status of a Creo model parameter.

GET_MDL_PATH.description: Retrieves the path of a specified model.

GET_MDL_REGEN_STATE.description: Retrieves the regeneration state of a solid model.

GET_MDL_SESSION_ID.description: Retrieves the session id of a solid model. This can be used to address models in a relation or for drawing notes.

GET_MDL_SUBTYPE.description: Retrieves the sub type of a model.

GET_MDL_TEXTS.description: Searches solid models and drawings for text information with font definitions. In parts and assemblies the sketches from extrusions and curve features are searched for this text information. In drawings it is searched in table texts and notes.

GET_MDL_TOL_CLASS.description: Reads the tolerance class of a model.

GET_MDL_TOL_STANDARD.description: Reads the tolerance standard of a model. The command is supported for Creo 2.0 M100 and above.

GET_MDL_TYPE.description: Retrieves the type of a model.

GET_MDL_TYPE_EX.description: Retrieves the type of the model including imported models with Creo Unite Technology.

GET_MDL_VERSION.description: Retrieves the internal version as an integer value. The version is a number which is incremented after every modification. It is not related to the file name number of Pro/ENGINEER models.

GET_MFG_ASM.description: Retrieves the associated assembly to a manufacturing assembly. In case the model is not a manufacturing assembly, the command retrieves the same model.

GET_MOUSE_POINT.description: Lets the user pick on the screen to return the pick position. The command can be used as well on solid models as on drawings. For solid models the depth is detected from the current view. The left mouse button is used to pick the position. The command can be canceled by the middle mouse button.

GET_NAMED_ORIENTATIONS.description: Retrieves the names of existing orientations from a model.

GET_NC_HEAD_TOOL_SETUPS.description: Gets the list of tool setups in a workcell head.

GET_NC_OPERATION_CSYS.description: Gets the zero point coordinate system for the operation program.

GET_NC_OPERATION_STEPS.description: Gets the steps of a NC operation.

GET_NC_OPERATION_WORKCELL.description: Gets the workcell for which a given operation is defined.

GET_NC_STEP_PARAM.description: Gets the value of a NC step parameter.

GET_NC_STEP_TOOL_SETUP.description: Gets the tool setup assigned to a NC step feature.

GET_NC_WORKCELL_PARAM.description: Gets the value of a NC workcell parameter.

GET_NEXT_MDL_NAME.description: Determines the next available name for a model of a specific type. Since Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire M070 this command also uses the PDMLink auto numbering.

GET_NOTE_TEXT.description: Retrieves the text from an existing note.

GET_NUM_NC_HEADS.description: Gets the number of heads in a NC workcell.

GET_ORIENTATION_MATRIX.description: Retrieves a named view or the current view of a model and stores the value as a matrix.

GET_PATTERN.description: Retrieves the reference to the pattern based on the reference to a pattern member.

GET_PATTERN_MEMBER.description: Retrieves the reference to a specified pattern member of the group. The input reference can be any feature inside this pattern.

GET_PATTERN_MEMBER_NUM.description: Retrieves the number of pattern members. The input reference can be any feature inside this pattern.

GET_PATTERN_TYPE.description: Retrieves the pattern type of a pattern.

GET_PDM_MODIFICATION_STATE.description: Determines if an object is modified locally or in the workspace. This could be used to determine if a model should be uploaded. The command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

GET_PDM_STATE.description: Determines by a reference whether a model is downloaded, checked out or no PDM object for Intralink 8.0 (and above) / PDMLink.

GET_PDM_STATE_BY_NAME.description: Determines by name whether a model is downloaded, checked out or no PDM object for Intralink 8.0 (and above) / PDMLink.

GET_PDM_STATE_BY_NAME_EX.description: Determines extended PDM information by name.

GET_PDM_STATE_EX.description: Determines extended PDM Information by a reference.

GET_PDM_STORAGE.description: Determines if the storage place of a model given by name for Intralink 8.0 (and above) / PDMLink.

GET_PIPELINE.description: Retrieves the pipeline feature of a model.

GET_PNT_INDEX.description: Determines the index of a point inside a point feature.

GET_PREDEFINED_FLEXIBLE_ITEMS.description: Retrieves an array of predefined flexible items. References are used for features and strings for parameters and dimensions. This function requires Creo 1.0 or above.

GET_PRO_PROGRAM_INPUT.description: Retrieves the input section information of Pro/PROGRAM from a model.

GET_PROE_MODE.description: Retrieves the mode in which Pro/ENGINEER / Creo is currently running.

GET_PROE_VERSION.description: Retrieves the version information from the current Pro/ENGINEER / Creo version as number and as string.

GET_QUILT_SURFACES.description: Retrieves the references of all surfaces which belong to the quilt.

GET_REF_ACP_IDS.description: Retrieves the ids of the assembly component path of a reference.

GET_REF_ACP_OWNER.description: Retrieves the owner of the assembly component path of a reference.

GET_REF_ANNOTATION_PLANE.description: Retrieves the annotation plane of a reference to an annotation.

GET_REF_CHILD.description: Gets the child model of a specified reference by declaring the path. The path is relative to the owner of the specified reference.

GET_REF_COMMON_PARENT.description: Retrieves the most immediate model which includes all specified references.

GET_REF_DEPEND_CHILD.description: Determines child feature of a specified reference.

GET_REF_DEPEND_CHILD_EX.description: Determines child feature of a specified reference and provides detailed information. This command extends the old command.

GET_REF_DEPEND_CHILDREN.description: Determines child features of a specified reference.

GET_REF_DEPEND_CHILDREN_EX.description: Determines child features of a specified reference and provides detailed information. This command extends the old command.

GET_REF_DEPEND_PARENT.description: Determines parent feature of a specified reference.

GET_REF_DEPEND_PARENT_EX.description: Determines parent feature of a specified reference and provides detailed information. This command extends the old command.

GET_REF_DEPEND_PARENTS.description: Determines parent features of a specified reference.

GET_REF_DEPEND_PARENTS_EX.description: Determines parent features of a specified reference. This command extends the old command.

GET_REF_FAMINSTANCE.description: Retrieves reference to a family table instance item based on a specific reference and the instance name.

GET_REF_GENERIC.description: Retrieves reference to the generic item based on a specified reference to a family table instance item.

GET_REF_ID.description: Gets Creo Elements/Pro id of a specified reference.

GET_REF_NAME.description: Gets name of a specified reference.

GET_REF_OWNER.description: Gets the owner of a specified reference. For features and geometrical entities the owner is the part or assembly which contains them. The owner of a part or assembly is the model itself.

GET_REF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION.description: Reads the description of a Creo reference parameter.

GET_REF_PARAM_LOCK_STATUS.description: Reads the lock status of a Creo reference parameter.

GET_REF_PARENT.description: Gets the parent of the owner of a specified reference.

GET_REF_POS.description: Retrieves position of a geometrical reference. If the reference was selected the pick position of the mouse is supplied. In case the reference was searched the result will be the center position.

GET_REF_STATE.description: Reports the current state of a reference by a string parameter. For example a state can be active or frozen.

GET_REF_TYPE.description: Gets type of a specified reference.

GET_REF_VERTEX.description: Gets a vertex to a specified reference to an edge, curve or composite curve.

GET_REGISTRY_STRING.description: Retrieves text from a registry value. In case the registry value has a different data type, the content is converted to a string.

GET_REGISTRY_STRINGS.description: Retrieves an array of text from the a registry value. In case the registry value has a different data type, the content of the array is converted to strings.

GET_RELATIONS.description: Gets all relations of a Creo Elements/Pro model, component or feature.

GET_RELATIONS_UNIT_SENSITIVE.description: Retrieves the sensitivity state of the model relations. This command requires Creo 2.0 M110 or above.

GET_ROW_ARRAY.description: Retrieves a specified row of an array with sub-arrays to get an array with plain elements. This is similar to receiving a row vector from a matrix.

GET_SA_VERSION.description: Retrieves the version release and datecode information from the current SmartAssembly build.

GET_SELBUFFER.description: Retrieves all references from the selection buffer.

GET_SERVER.description: Retrieves the names of the active server or of an offline server.

GET_SERVERS.description: Retrieves the names of all servers, even if they are offline.

GET_SESSION_MDLS.description: Retrieves and array of all models which are currently in session.

GET_SIMPREP_DEFAULT_ACTION.description: Determines the default action of an existing simplified representation.

GET_SMT_BEND_EDGE_CHILD.description: Determines the most recent child edge of the specified bend / unbend operation.

GET_SMT_BEND_EDGE_PARENT.description: Determines the most recent parent edge of the specified bend / unbend operation.

GET_SMT_BEND_SURFACE_CHILD.description: Determines the most recent child surface of the specified bend / unbend surface.

GET_SMT_BEND_SURFACE_PARENT.description: Determines the most recent parent surface of the specified bend / unbend surface.

GET_SMT_BEND_SURFACE_PROPS.description: Determines the properties of a bend surface.

GET_SMT_EDGE_OPPOSITE.description: Determines the opposite edge of a sheet metal Model. The function provides the white side if the green was supplied and vice versa. For any other references the function will fail.

GET_SMT_SURFACE_OPPOSITE.description: Determines the opposite surface of a sheet metal surface. The function provides the white side if the green was supplied and vice versa. For any other references the function will fail.

GET_SMT_SURFACE_TYPE.description: Gets the type of a sheet metal surface.

GET_STOPWATCH_TIME.description: Gets the current time of the stopwatch.

GET_SURFACE_AT_POS.description: Determines the surface among an array of surfaces which contains the specified position.

GET_SURFACE_CONTOUR.description: Retrieves the information about one contour of a surface.

GET_SURFACE_CONTOURS.description: Retrieves the information about all contours of a surface.

GET_SURFACE_NORM.description: Determines the normal vector on a surface. If the surface was selected, the normal vector is determined in the selection position. Otherwise the center point is used.

GET_SURFACE_QUILT.description: Retrieves the reference to a quilt from a surface.

GET_SURFACE_REV_AXIS.description: Retrieves the reference to an axis from a cylinder or cone surface reference.

GET_SURFACE_SETUP_TYPE.description: Gets setup type of a specified reference.

GET_SURFACE_TYPE.description: Gets geometrical type of a specified surface.

GET_SURFACES_AT_POS.description: Determines the surfaces among an array of surfaces which contains the specified position.

GET_SURFFINISH_VALUE.description: Retrieves the value from a surface finish created by a symbol from the variable text in . In case variable text does not exists an error occurs.

GET_SYMBOL_GROUP_EXCLUSIVE.description: Examines if a symbol group is exclusive or independent.

GET_SYMBOL_GROUP_SHOWN.description: Examines if a symbol group is visible or not.

GET_SYMBOL_NAME.description: Retrieves the name of a symbol.

GET_SYMBOL_POS.description: Retrieves the position of a symbol.

GET_SYMBOL_STRING.description: Retrieves character symbol encodings to be placed on notes or geometric tolerances. This command requires Creo 4.0 or above.

GET_TAB_LINE_NUM.description: Retrieves the current line number of the program file which is processed.

GET_TAB_NAME.description: Retrieves the name of the current program file which is processed.

GET_TAB_STACK.description: Retrieves the call stack for the current program file.

GET_TAB_STACK_DEPTH.description: Retrieves the depth of the current call stack.

GET_TBLPATTERN_DATA.description: Reads data of a table pattern in an array.

GET_TBLPATTERN_TABLES.description: Retrieves the names of the table pattern tables in an array.

GET_TEXTURE_PLACEMENT_PROPS.description: Gets the texture placement properties of assemblies, parts, components and surfaces.

GET_TEXTURE_PROPS.description: Gets the texture properties of assemblies, parts, components and surfaces.

GET_TIME_STRING.description: Retrieves time and date as a string from the operation system.

GET_TOPLEVEL_ASMS.description: Determines the assemblies from an given array of models which are not included in another assembly.

GET_TOPLEVEL_MDLS.description: Determines the parts and assemblies from an given array of models which are not included in another assembly.

GET_TRANSLATION.description: Receives the translation strings from according to the specified path and language. Percentage signs can be used as placeholders for variables.

GET_UDF_DATA.description: Retrieves the data from a UDF () file.

GET_UNIT_FORCE.description: Reads the current unit for force from a model.

GET_UNIT_LENGTH.description: Reads the current unit for length from a model.

GET_UNIT_MASS.description: Reads the current unit for mass from a model.

GET_UNIT_SYSTEM.description: Reads the current unit system from a model.

GET_UNIT_TEMPERATURE.description: Reads the current unit for temperature from a model.

GET_UNIT_TIME.description: Reads the current unit for time from a model.

GET_VARIED_ITEMS.description: Retrieves an array of varied items. References are used for features and strings for parameters and dimensions. This function requires Creo 1.0 or above.

GET_WORKING_DIRECTORY.description: Retrieves the information of the current working directory and stores it to a variable.

GET_WORKSPACE_CONTEXT.description: Retrieves the of context of a specified workspace of the current PDMLink session.

GET_WORKSPACES.description: Retrieves the names of all workspaces of the current PDMLink session. In case no workspace is available, the results is an empty array.

GET_XSEC.description: Retrieve a cross section from a solid model. This command is only available for Creo 2.0 and above.

GET_XSEC_PROPERTIES.description: Calculates the cross section properties of a planar section similar to . In case the coordinate system is from another model, a temporary one will be created for the measurement.

GET_XSECS.description: Retrieve cross sections from a solid model. This command is only available for Creo 2.0 and above.

GLOBAL_PICTURE.description: Specifies an gif image to display in the dialog box. In case the configuration option IMAGE_GRAPHICS is set to GDIPLUS, also bmp, jpeg and tiff images can be used.

HIDE.description: Hides a feature. This command requires Creo Elements/Pro Wildfire 4 or above.

HIGHLIGHT_REF.description: Highlights a reference in Creo Elements/Pro.

IF.description: Determines if a block of code is computed or not through evaluating a condition term.

IMPORT_FEATURE.description: Imports geometry as a Creo Elements/Pro feature like .

IMPORT_MDL.description: Imports geometry as a Creo Elements/Pro model like

IMPORT_NC_TOOL_XML.description: Imports a NC tool definition from a XML file and assigns it to the active workcell.

IMPORT_PRO_PROGRAM.description: Import the Pro/PROGRAM information of a model like .

INCLUDE.description: Includes another script file by specifying the file name. The script file execution starts in the assembly description block.

INCLUDE_TO_SIMPREP.description: Include a component in a simplified representation. This works only for assemblies, but not for parts.

INFO_ENGINE_AUTHENTICATE.description: Authenticates a Windchill domain with user and password information via the password database. This authentication is valid for the complete SmartAssembly session.

INFO_ENGINE_QUERY.description: To query data from a Windchill Info*Engine URL by passing information via the query URL.

INSERT_ARRAY_ELEM.description: Inserts a new element of an of type parameter, reference or array. That means an array can be an elements of another array. In case the index exceeds the number of existing elements, a new element is appended at the end of the array.

INSERT_DRW_SHEET.description: Inserts a new sheet to a drawing.

INSERT_DRW_TABLE_COL.description: Inserts a column to an existing drawing table.

INSERT_DRW_TABLE_ROW.description: Inserts a row to an existing drawing table.

INSERT_FAMINSTANCE.description: Inserts new instances to a family table.

INSERT_FAMITEM.description: Inserts family table item to a family table to the specified generic.

INSERT_VARIED_ITEM.description: Inserts a parameter, a dimension or a feature as varied item to an inheritance feature or a flexible component. This function requires Creo 1.0 or above.

INTEGRATE_NESTED_FAMINSTANCES.description: This command helps to restructure nested family table instances. It integrates all tested family table instances to the specified generic.

INVERT_MATRIX.description: Calculates the inverse of a matrix.

JLINK_TASK_EXEC.description: Executes a task of a loaded J-Link application.

JSON_COMPOSE_PATH.description: Zooms to a reference in the current model on the screen.

JSON_DOCUMENT_TO_STRING.description: Converts an existing JSON document to a string.

JSON_GET_ARRAY_ELEMS.description: Retrieves the paths of all JSON array elements in an array.

JSON_GET_ARRAY_SIZE.description: Retrieves the number of all JSON array elements.

JSON_GET_NEXT_ARRAY_ELEM.description: Retrieves path to create the next JSON array element.

JSON_GET_OBJECT_MEMBERS.description: Retrieves the paths of all JSON object members in an array.

JSON_GET_TYPE.description: Retrieves the type of a JSON value.

JSON_GET_VALUE.description: Reads a value from a JSON document by specifying its path.

JSON_INIT_DOCUMENT.description: Initializes a JSON document from string.

JSON_LOAD_DOCUMENT.description: Loads a JSON document from file.

JSON_NEW_DOCUMENT.description: Creates a new empty JSON document.

JSON_SAVE_DOCUMENT.description: Saves a JSON document to disk.

JSON_SET_ARRAY.description: Creates an array in a JSON document by specifying its path.

JSON_SET_NULL.description: Creates a null value in a JSON document by specifying its path.

JSON_SET_OBJECT.description: Creates an object in a JSON document by specifying its path.

JSON_SET_VALUE.description: Creates a value in a JSON document by specifying its path and value.

LINK_SKETCH.description: Redefines the sketch of a feature according to the shape of a surface or curve by adjusting the sketch. No dependency to the source surface or curve is created.

LINK_SKETCH_MDL.description: Redefines the sketch of a feature according to the shape of a section model.

LOAD_CONFIG_OPTIONS.description: Reads a configuration file for the current Creo Parametric session.

LOAD_DRW_OPTIONS.description: Applies the drawing options of a dtl file.

LOAD_MDL.description: Executes file open dialog and lets the user select a model.

LOAD_MDL_DTL_OPTIONS.description: Applies the detail options to a solid model from a dtl file.

LOAD_MDL_TOL_TABLE.description: Load the tolerance table for a model.

LOOKUP_FAMINSTANCE.description: Searches a family table instance name according to dimension or parameter values of the family item. In case of several matching instances the first one is returned.

LOOKUP_FAMINSTANCES.description: Searches all family table instance names according to dimension or parameter values of the family items.

MEASURE_ANGLE.description: Computes the angle between two specified references.

MEASURE_AREA.description: Computes the area of selected surface references.

MEASURE_DIAMETER.description: Computes the diameter of a specified reference.

MEASURE_DISTANCE.description: Computes the distance between two specified references.

MEASURE_LENGTH.description: Computes the length of a specified reference.

MEASURE_RADIUS.description: Computes the radius of a specified reference.

MERGE_DRW_TABLE.description: Merges the specified cells in a drawing table.

MERGE_DRWS.description: Merges a drawing to an existing one. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

MESSAGE_BOX.description: Shows a message in a box. The program will halt until the user is pressing the OK button.

MESSAGE_BOX_EX.description: Extended version of the message box. Shows a message in a box with buttons. The program will halt until the user is pressing a button or the cancel button in the title bar.
