MODIFY_COMB_VIEW.description: Modifies and existing combined view. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

MODIFY_COMPONENT.description: Executes the modify functionality of a former created component.

MODIFY_DRW_NOTE_EX.description: Modifies an existing note on a drawing.

MODIFY_EXPLODE_STATE.description: Modifies an explode state in an assembly. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

MODIFY_FIELD_POINT.description: Modifies the placement reference of a field point.

MODIFY_GENERAL_POINT.description: Modifies a general point datum feature.

MODIFY_GTOL.description: Modifies a geometric tolerance in solids or drawings. This command requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 or above.

MODIFY_GTOL_CREO4.description: Modifies a geometric tolerance in solids or drawings with the new functionality in Creo 4.0 and above. This command requires Creo 4.0 or above.

MODIFY_HOLE.description: Modifies a hole feature. This command requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 4 or above.

MODIFY_NC_STEP.description: Redefines an NC step feature with the data from a given NC_STEP structure.

MODIFY_NOTE_EX.description: Modifies an existing note in a solid model.

MODIFY_POINTS_EX.description: Modifies a datum point offset coordinate system feature with several points inside.

MODIFY_SURFFINISH.description: Modifies the surface finish in a solid model.

MODIFY_SYMBOL.description: Modifies an existing symbol in a solid model.

MOVE_ANNOTATION_TO_ORIENTATION.description: Moves annotation elements to an orientation.

MOVE_ANNOTATION_TO_PLANE.description: Moves annotation elements to a specified plane.

MOVE_DRW_DIM.description: Moves a drawing dimension to a specified position. This command is valid for shown and created dimensions.

MOVE_DRW_NOTE_TO_VIEW.description: Moves a drawing note to a specified view.

MOVE_DRW_SYMBOL_TO_VIEW.description: Moves a drawing symbol to a specified view.

MOVE_DRW_VIEW.description: Moves a view on a drawing to the desired position.

MOVE_FILE.description: Moves a file to a new name or to a new position in the file system.

MOVE_FROM_FOOTER.description: Moves a feature or an array of features from the footer.

MOVE_TO_FOOTER.description: Moves a feature or an array of features to the footer.

PARSE_FILE_NAME.description: Parses a give file name and extracts path, name and extension.

PARSE_STRING.description: Reads formatted data from a string. The format control string determines which part of the input string is stored in the different variables. Spaces and tabulators are ignored in the input and in the format string. The command does not only allow to retrieve variables, it can also be used to control that the string follows specific rules.

PARSE_STRING_EX.description: Reads formatted data from a string and stores the result in an array. The format control string determines which part of the input string is stored in the different variables. Spaces and tabulators are ignored in the input and in the format string. The command does not only allow to retrieve variables, it can also be used to control that the string follows specific rules.

PLOT.description: Plots a drawing on the printer according to a printer PCF file.

PREDEFINE_FLEXIBILITY.description: Predefines varied items on a model to be used later on when using the model as a flexible component. This function requires Creo 1.0 or above.

PRINT.description: Output of text messages in the Creo Elements/Pro message area.

PROBE_DRW_SYMBOL_LEGACY.description: Identifies legacy drawing symbols from earlier Pro/ENGINEER versions which are not displayed, but found by .

PROCESS_PROE_EVENTS.description: Stops the processing of further commands for a short while and allows waiting Creo events to be processed. This could be used for example for wait for rule based layers to populate new features.

PROCESSING_BOX_END.description: Terminates an active processing dialog box.

PROCESSING_BOX_SET_STATE.description: Displays a process bar in the processing dialog box and sets the current percentage.

PROCESSING_BOX_START.description: Shows a processing dialog box in the bottom right corner while the tab file is processed.

PURGE.description: Purges the files in a directory.

PURGE_UNUSED_DRW_SYMBOLS.description: Purges drawing symbols which are not used on the drawing.

PURGE_UNUSED_SYMBOLS.description: Purges symbols which are not used on the solid model. This command requires Creo 4.0 M090 / Creo 5.0.4.0 or above.

RADIOBUTTON_PARAM.description: Radio button in graphical user interface. A radio button provides a list of options to the user while allowing to select exactly one of those.

READ_ANNOTATION_PLANE.description: Reads the information how the annotation plane was created.

READ_DATUM_TAG.description: Reads the properties of an existing datum tag.

READ_DATUM_TARGET.description: Reads the properties of an existing datum target.

READ_DIM_ANNOTATION.description: Reads the properties of an existing annotation dimension.

READ_DIRECTORY.description: Reads file list from directory in an array of strings.

READ_DRW_NOTE_EX.description: Reads the information from an existing note on a drawing.

READ_EXPLODE_STATE.description: Reads in the definition of an explode state from an assembly. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

READ_EXTERNAL_DATA.description: Reads external data by keyword from a model.

READ_EXTERNAL_DATA_SLOT.description: Reads the content of an external data slot.

READ_FIELD_POINT.description: Retrieves the placement reference of a field point.

READ_GENERAL_POINT.description: Retrieves the description of a general point datum feature.

READ_GTOL.description: Reads a geometric tolerance definition of solids or drawings. This command requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 or above.

READ_GTOL_CREO4.description: Reads a geometric tolerance definition of solids or drawings with the new functionality in Creo 4.0 and above. This command requires Creo 4.0 or above.

READ_HOLE.description: Reads the description of a hole feature. This command requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 4 or above.

READ_NC_STEP.description: Gets the description of an NC step feature.

READ_NOTE_EX.description: Reads the information from an existing note in an solid model.

READ_POINTS_EX.description: Reads the description of a datum point offset coordinate system feature with several points inside.

READ_SUBDIRECTORIES.description: Reads names of sub directories and stores them to an array.

READ_SURFFINISH.description: Retrieves the information from a surface finish in a solid model.

READ_SYMBOL.description: Reads the information from an existing symbol in an solid model.

READ_XSEC_EX.description: Reads the definition of an existing planar cross section.

REFERENCE_TO_STRING.description: Converts a reference variable to two strings. One for the model for which is the owner of the reference and one for the reference content.

REG_EXP_FIND_ALL.description: Searches for all regular expressions matches in an input string.

REG_EXP_MATCH.description: Tests if an input string matches a regular expression pattern. This command only succeeds if the complete string is matched.

REG_EXP_REPLACE.description: Searches for regular expression matches in an input string and replaces them.

REG_EXP_SEARCH.description: Searches for the next regular expression match in an input string.

REGEN_RELATIONS.description: Regenerates all relations of a Creo Elements/Pro model, component or feature.

REMOVE_ALL_CONSTRAINTS.description: Removes all constraints of a placed component, including interface constraints. This command is available since Creo 2.0 M230 / Creo 3.0 M110and above.

REMOVE_COLOR_PROPS.description: Removes the color properties from assemblies, parts, features, curves or surfaces.

REMOVE_COMB_VIEW_ANNOTATIONS.description: Removes annotations from a combined view. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

REMOVE_COMPONENT.description: Removes a specified part or assembly component.

REMOVE_CONSTRAINT.description: Removes a constraint of a placed component.

REMOVE_DIRECTORY.description: Removes a directory from the file system.

REMOVE_DRW_SHEET.description: Removes an existing sheet from a drawing.

REMOVE_DRW_TABLE_COL.description: Removes a column of an existing drawing table.

REMOVE_DRW_TABLE_ROW.description: Removes a row of an existing drawing table.

REMOVE_FEATURES.description: Removes an array of features in a model.

REMOVE_FROM_LAYER.description: Removes geometry elements, features, parts or sub-assemblies features from a layer.

REMOVE_LAYER.description: Removes a layer from a model.

REMOVE_LAYER_STATE.description: Removes layer states from a solid model. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

REMOVE_LAYER_STATE_LAYER.description: Removes layers from a layer state. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

REMOVE_NC_TOOL_FROM_HEAD.description: Removes a tool from a NC workcell head.

REMOVE_PATTERN.description: Removes a pattern by preserving the patterned feature.

REMOVE_RELATIONS.description: Removes all relations from a model.

REMOVE_SIMPREPS.description: Removes one or an array of simplified representations.

REMOVE_SKETCH_REFS.description: Removes all sketch references and uses a coordinate system reference instead.

REMOVE_VARIED_ITEM.description: Removes a parameter, a dimension or a feature as varied item for an inheritance feature or a flexible component. This function requires Creo 1.0 or above.

REMOVE_WORKSPACE_OBJECTS.description: Removes objects by name or by reference from the current workspace of the active PDMLink server.

REORDER_DRW_SHEET.description: Reorder a sheet on a drawing.

REORDER_FEATURES.description: Reorders features in the Creo Elements/Pro model tree.

REPLACE_COMPONENT.description: Replaces an existing component through another one. References are maintained in case they are identical, that means they have the same Creo Elements/Pro identifier.

REPLACE_DRW_VIEW_MDL.description: Replaces the model of a drawing view. This function works only for replacing models of the same family table.

RETRIEVE_MDL.description: Retrieves a model specified by name. To retrieve an instance of a family table, use as Creo Elements/Pro does.

RETRIEVE_REFERENCE.description: Retrieves a reference information from a component feature. This command is useful for retrieving reference information from previously created components in case of .

RETURN.description: Returns from the program file with the specified value. This is currently only used for the notification MDL_RENAME_PRE and MDL_SAVE_PRE to avoid renaming or saving of a model.

ROTATE_DRW_VIEW.description: Rotates a drawing view normal to the drawing area.

SAVE_DRW_TABLE.description: Saves an existing drawing table in text, csv or tbl file.

SAVE_LAYER_STATE.description: Saves a layer state in a solid model. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above. For Creo 2.0 before M170 and Creo 3.0 before M050, the command will not cause an error, but also not save the layer state.

SAVE_LAYER_STATUS.description: Save layer status in Creo Elements/Pro models.

SAVE_MDL.description: Saves a Creo Elements/Pro model to disk.

SAVE_REFERENCE.description: Stores a reference information to a component feature. This command is useful for supplying reference information for components which should be created by .

SEARCH_CUSTOM_SIMPREP.description: Searches a model for a custom simplified representation.

SEARCH_CUSTOM_SIMPREPS.description: Searches a model for an array of custom simplified representations.

SEARCH_DESIGN_SERVER_VARIABLE_NAMES.description: Searches for variable names from the SmartDesignServer job by a search string.

SEARCH_DRW_ITEM.description: Searches for a drawing item by specifying view, sheet, identifier and type.

SEARCH_DRW_ITEMS.description: Searches for an array of drawing items by specifying view, sheet, identifier and type.

SEARCH_DRW_SYMBOL_GROUP_NAMES.description: Searches the names of groups in a symbol.

SEARCH_DRW_SYMBOL_VAR_TEXT.description: Searches the variable text of a symbol for a specific entry and retrieve its value.

SEARCH_DRW_SYMBOL_VAR_TEXT_NAMES.description: Searches the names of variable texts in a symbol.

SEARCH_DRW_SYMBOLS.description: Searches for drawing symbols. Name and sheet number can be specified or wild cards can be used for them.

SEARCH_DRW_TABLES_FOR_MDL.description: Searches for tables on a drawing which use a specific model for its repeat region.

SEARCH_DRW_VIEW.description: Searches for a view in a Creo Elements/Pro drawing.

SEARCH_DRW_VIEW_DIMS.description: Searches for dimensions in a drawing view by specifying the name with wildcards.

SEARCH_DRW_VIEWS.description: Searches for a views in a Creo Elements/Pro drawing by specifying name and sheet number with wildcards.

SEARCH_ENUMERATED_FEAT_PARAM_NAME.description: Searches for a restricted enumerated parameter of a specific name in a feature.

SEARCH_ENUMERATED_FEAT_PARAM_NAMES.description: Searches for restricted enumerated parameters of a specific name in a feature.

SEARCH_ENUMERATED_MDL_PARAM_NAME.description: Searches for a restricted enumerated parameter of a specific name in a model.

SEARCH_ENUMERATED_MDL_PARAM_NAMES.description: Searches for restricted enumerated parameters of a specific name in a model.

SEARCH_ENUMERATED_REF_PARAM_NAME.description: Searches for a restricted enumerated parameter of a specific name in a reference.

SEARCH_ENUMERATED_REF_PARAM_NAMES.description: Searches for restricted enumerated parameters of a specific name in a reference.

SEARCH_FEAT_PARAM.description: Searches for a specific parameter in a feature.

SEARCH_FEAT_PARAM_NAME.description: Searches for a parameter of a specific name in a feature.

SEARCH_FEAT_PARAM_NAMES.description: Searches for parameters of a specific name in a feature.

SEARCH_FEAT_REF.description: Searches for a named reference in a Creo Elements/Pro feature.

SEARCH_FEAT_REFS.description: Searches for all named reference in a Creo Elements/Pro feature.

SEARCH_FILE_PARAM.description: Searches for a content in a specified file. The file lines are build up in the manner .

SEARCH_LINESTOCK_PARAM.description: Searches for a linestock parameter of in a pipeline feature.

SEARCH_MDL_OR_COMP_PARAM.description: Recursive search for a parameter with a specific name. The search starts with the specified model and checks if its component or the model contains the parameter. In case it does not, the search will be done in the parameter model and so forth.

SEARCH_MDL_PARAM.description: Searches for a parameter or dimension with a specific name in an Creo Elements/Pro model.

SEARCH_MDL_PARAM_NAME.description: Searches for a parameter of a specific name in a model.

SEARCH_MDL_PARAM_NAMES.description: Searches for parameters of a specific name in a model.

SEARCH_MDL_REF.description: Searches for a named reference in a Creo Elements/Pro model.

SEARCH_MDL_REFS.description: Searches for all named reference in a Creo Elements/Pro model.

SEARCH_REF_PARAM.description: Searches for a specific parameter in a reference.

SEARCH_REF_PARAM_NAME.description: Searches for a parameter of a specific name in a reference.

SEARCH_REF_PARAM_NAMES.description: Searches for parameters of a specific name in a reference.

SEARCH_RELATION_ELEMENTS.description: Searches in a model for all elements which own a relation set. That can be the model itself, component features, features and patterns.

SEARCH_RELATIONS.description: Searches for specific relations of a Creo Elements/Pro model, component or feature.

SEARCH_STAGE_ORIENT_PLANE.description: Searches for a datum plane in specified model. This command could be used to retrieve an orientation reference for UDF placement or assembling.

SEARCH_STAMP_REF.description: Searches for a named surface in the selected models. The search is done in z direction. Use this command to specify a tool plate at a position

SEARCH_SYMBOL_GROUP_NAMES.description: Searches the names of groups in a symbol.

SEARCH_SYMBOL_VAR_TEXT.description: Searches the variable text of a symbol for a specific entry and retrieve its value.

SEARCH_SYMBOL_VAR_TEXT_NAMES.description: Searches the names of variable texts in a symbol.

SEARCH_UDF_DIM.description: Searches for a variable dimension from a user defined feature.

SEARCH_VARIABLE.description: Searches an existing variable by name. Wildcards can be used for the search.

SEARCH_VARIABLE_NAMES.description: Searches for the names of existing variables by a search string.

SEARCH_VARIABLES.description: Searches existing variables by name. Wildcards can be used for the search.

SELECT_FAMINSTANCE.description: Shows up a selection dialog to let the user select an instance of the family table.

SEND_MAIL.description: Sends mails via the specified mail server.

SET_ACCURACY.description: Sets the accuracy of a model.

SET_ACTIVE_COMB_VIEW.description: Sets the active combined view. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

SET_ANNOTATION_ELEMENT.description: Removes existing elements from the annotation and places a new one instead.

SET_ANNOTATION_ELEMENT_NAME.description: Sets the name of a specified annotation element which is contained by an annotation feature.

SET_ANNOTATION_ELEMENTS.description: Removes existing elements from the annotation and places the new ones instead.

SET_ANNOTATION_PLANE_NAME.description: Sets the name of an annotation plane and optionally adds it to the gallery. This command requires Creo 4.0 M130, Creo 6.0.5.0 or above. Creo 5.0 is not supported.

SET_ANNOTATION_POS.description: Sets the position of an annotation.

SET_ANNOTATION_TEXT_STYLE.description: Sets the text style for an annotation.

SET_ARRAY_ELEM.description: Updates an existing element of an of type parameter, reference or array. That means an array can be an elements of another array. In case the index exceeds the number of existing elements, a new element is appended at the end of the array.

SET_AUTO_REORDER.description: Reorders a feature to a specific position in the model tree. The feature is always moved in the defined position for each regeneration, save and creation of a new feature.

SET_AUTO_TRANSLATION_LANGUAGE.description: Sets the default language for the .

SET_AUTO_TRANSLATION_PATH.description: Sets the default path for the .

SET_BROWSER_SIZE.description: Sets the size of the Creo embedded browser in percentage of coverage of the Creo window. The values in the range 0.0 to 100.0.

SET_COLOR.description: Sets rgb color of assembly, part, feature, curve or surface via specifying intensity of red, green and blue between 0 and 255.

SET_COLOR_PROPS.description: Sets the color properties of assemblies, parts, features, curves or surfaces.

SET_COMB_VIEW_ANNOTATION_VISIBILITY.description: Sets the visibility state of annotations in a combined view. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

SET_COMB_VIEW_ANNOTATIONS.description: Sets the annotations of a combined view. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

SET_COMB_VIEW_NAME.description: Renames an existing combined view of a model. This command requires Creo Parametric 1.0 or above.

SET_COMMON_NAME.description: Sets the PTC_COMMON_NAME parameter of a model. Since the . This command requires Creo Elements/Pro Wildfire 4 or above.

SET_COMP_PLACED.description: Sets the placement state of a component. Unplaced component are usually created via .

SET_COMP_POS.description: Sets the position of a component which is under-constraint.

SET_COMP_TYPE.description: Sets the type of a component.

SET_CONFIG_HTML_DATA.description: Sets the data to return to the web page called from .

SET_CONFIG_OPTION.description: Sets the value of a Creo Elements/Pro configuration option.

SET_CONSEC_FEAT_PARAM.description: Creates a new feature parameter with a consecutive number at the end of the name.

SET_CONSEC_MDL_PARAM.description: Creates a new model parameter with a consecutive number at the end of the name.

SET_CONSTRAINT.description: Modifies a constraint of a component.

SET_CONSTRAINTS.description: Set the constrains for a component.

SET_CURRENT_MDL.description: Makes a model the current model on the screen.

SET_DATUM_TAG_LABEL.description: Sets the label of a datum tag. For the new Creo 4.0 datum tags this is the label, for legacy datum tags it is the name of the related datum plane.

SET_DENSITY.description: Sets the density of a part.

SET_DIM_DECIMALS.description: Sets the number of decimals places of a dimension.

SET_DIM_DISPLAY_ROUNDED.description: Set the information if the dimension should be displayed as a rounded value. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

SET_DIM_DISPLAY_TYPE.description: Modifies the display type of a dimension.

SET_DIM_OVERRIDE_VALUE.description: Sets the dimension override value for a created dimension.

SET_DIM_TEXT.description: Sets dimension value for a dimension reference.

SET_DIM_TOL.description: Sets the upper and lower limit from a tolerance of a dimension.

SET_DIM_TOL_TABLE.description: Sets the tolerance table for a dimension.

SET_DIM_TOL_TYPE.description: Modifies the tolerance type of a dimension.

SET_DIM_VALUE.description: Sets dimension value for a dimension reference.

SET_DIM_VALUE_DISPLAY_TYPE.description: Sets the value display type for a created dimension.

SET_DRF_CSYS_ORIENTATION.description: Sets the orientation of the coordinate system which is related to the datum reference frame.

SET_DRW_ANNOTATION_TEXT_STYLE.description: Sets the text style for a drawing annotation.

SET_DRW_CUR_SHEET.description: Activates a specific sheet of a drawing.

SET_DRW_FORMAT.description: Sets the format of a drawing. Tables from older formats will be removed.

SET_DRW_ITEM_VIEW.description: Relates a drawing item to a specific view.

SET_DRW_ITEMS_VIEW.description: Relates an array of drawing items to a specific view.

SET_DRW_LAYER_STATUS.description: Switches display status of an independent drawing layer.

SET_DRW_LAYER_STATUS_EX.description: Switches display status of an independent drawing layer. Extended version of to set more visibility states.

SET_DRW_MDL.description: Sets the active model of a drawing.

SET_DRW_NOTE_ANGLE.description: Modifies the angle of a drawing note.

SET_DRW_NOTE_LEADER.description: Sets one leader or an array of leaders for a drawing note.

SET_DRW_NOTE_POS.description: Modifies the position of a drawing note.

SET_DRW_NOTE_TEXT.description: Sets the text of an existing drawing note.

SET_DRW_NOTE_TEXT_ALIGNMENT.description: Sets the horizontal and vertical alignment of an existing drawing note.

SET_DRW_NOTE_TEXT_FONT.description: Sets the text font of an existing drawing note.

SET_DRW_NOTE_TEXT_HEIGHT.description: Sets the text height of an existing drawing note.

SET_DRW_OPTIONS.description: Sets the options of a drawing.

SET_DRW_REF_VIEW.description: Assigns the the reference of a drawing view to an existing reference.

SET_DRW_SCALE.description: Sets scale of drawing view or of drawing.

SET_DRW_SIZE.description: Sets the size of a drawing sheet by name or by width and height.

SET_DRW_SYMBOL_GROUP_SHOWN.description: Sets a symbol group visible or not visible.

SET_DRW_SYMBOL_LEADER.description: Sets one leader or an array of leaders for a drawing symbol.

SET_DRW_SYMBOL_POS.description: Modifies the position of a drawing symbol.

SET_DRW_SYMBOL_VAR_TEXT.description: Sets the variable text of a drawing symbol by its name.

SET_DRW_TABLE_COL_WIDTH.description: Set the width of a drawing table column.

SET_DRW_TABLE_FORMAT.description: Assigns formatting information to a table cell on a drawing.

SET_DRW_TABLE_GROWTH_DIR.description: Sets the growth direction of a drawing table.

SET_DRW_TABLE_POS.description: Sets the position of a drawing table.

SET_DRW_TABLE_ROW_HEIGHT.description: Set the height ot a drawing table row.

SET_DRW_TABLE_TEXT.description: Inserts text to a drawing table.

SET_DRW_VIEW_BROKEN_AREA.description: Sets a broken area of an existing drawing view. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

SET_DRW_VIEW_DETAIL_OUTLINE.description: Sets a new outline spline for an existing detail view based on a specified outline curve. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

SET_DRW_VIEW_DETAIL_OUTLINE_CIRCLE.description: Sets a new circular outline spline for an existing detail view based. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

SET_DRW_VIEW_DISPLAY.description: Sets the display status of an existing drawing view.

SET_DRW_VIEW_NAME.description: Sets the name of a drawing view. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

SET_DRW_VIEW_ORIENTATION.description: Re-orients an existing drawing view according to specified model view.

SET_DRW_VIEW_PARTIAL_AREA.description: Sets a partial area in an existing drawing view. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

SET_DRW_VIEW_QUILT_HLR.description: Sets the hidden line removal option for quilts on a drawing view.

SET_DRW_VIEW_SIMPREP.description: Set the active simplified representation of the drawing view. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

SET_DRW_VIEW_SKELETON_DISPLAY.description: Sets the skeleton model display option for a drawing view

SET_DRW_VIEW_STATE.description: Suppresses or resumes a drawing view. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 / Creo Elements/Pro 5 or above.

SET_DRW_VIEW_TANGENT_EDGE_DISPLAY.description: Sets the display style for tangent edges.

SET_FAMITEM_STATE.description: Sets the state of a family table item a specific instance to suppressed or resumed.

SET_FAMITEM_VALUE.description: Sets the value of a family table item for a specific instance and stores it to a variable of type parameter.

SET_FEAT_PARAM.description: Creates or updates a feature parameter or dimension with a specified value.

SET_FEAT_PARAM_DESCRIPTION.description: Sets the description of a Creo feature parameter.

SET_FEAT_PARAM_LOCK_STATUS.description: Sets the lock status of a Creo feature parameter.

SET_FEATURE_DEPENDENCY.description: Sets the dependency of a copy geom feature.

SET_FEATURE_NAME.description: Sets name to a specified feature.

SET_FEATURE_STATE.description: Suppresses or resumes a specified features.

SET_FEATURE_UPDATE_NOTIFICATION.description: Sets the update notification status of a copy geometry feature. This command requires Creo 3.0 or above. In case the Creo license option , the function will not do anything.

SET_FLEXIBLE.description: Makes an existing component flexible and defines its varied items. The function requires Creo 1.0 or above.

SET_FLEXIBLE_PREDEFINED.description: Makes an existing component flexible by using its predefined varied items. This function requires Creo 1.0 or above.

SET_GTOL_TEXT.description: Sets the text of a geometric tolerance in solids or drawings. This command requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 5 or above.

SET_IDENTIFIER.description: Set a new session identifier from the content of a variable.

SET_LAYER_STATE_LAYER_STATUS.description: Sets the layer visibility information in a layer state. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

SET_LAYER_STATE_REF_STATUS.description: Adds or removes references to and from a layer state in a solid model. The layer state should be saved afterwards in order to make the changes active. This command requires Creo Parametric 2.0 or above.

SET_LAYER_STATUS.description: Sets layer status for a specific layer.

SET_LAYER_STATUS_EX.description: Sets layer status for a specific layer. Extended version of to set more visibility states.

SET_LINE_FONT.description: Sets the line font of a curve or composite curve similar to .

SET_LINESTOCK_PARAM.description: Sets the value for a linestock parameter.

SET_MATERIAL.description: Sets and assigns material to a model.

SET_MATERIAL_PROPERTIES.description: Set the standard properties of the assigned material of a model.

SET_MATERIAL_PROPERTY.description: Set a property to the assigned material of a model. This allows also to access custom material properties.

SET_MDL_DTL_OPTION.description: Assigns a specific detail option to a solid model.

SET_MDL_DTL_OPTIONS.description: Assigns the detail options to a solid model.

SET_MDL_MODIFIED.description: Sets the modification flag of the model. This makes sure the model will be regarded as changed for the a save command.

SET_MDL_NAME.description: renames a specified model. In case the model already exists on hard drive or in the workspace the renamed model will be saved. When renaming a part or an assembly available drawings of the same name will be renamed accordingly.

SET_MDL_PARAM.description: Creates or update a model parameter or a dimension with a specified value.

SET_MDL_PARAM_DESCRIPTION.description: Sets the description of a Creo model parameter.

SET_MDL_PARAM_LOCK_STATUS.description: Sets the lock status of a Creo model parameter.

SET_MDL_SCALE.description: Scales a model by a factor. Similar to in Pro/ENGINEER / Creo Parametric.

SET_MDL_TOL_CLASS.description: Sets the tolerance class of a model.

SET_MDL_TOL_STANDARD.description: Sets the tolerance standard of a model. The command is supported since Creo 2.0 M100 and above.

SET_NC_STEP_PARAM.description: Sets the value of a NC step parameter.

SET_NC_STEP_TOOL.description: Assigns a tool to a NC step feature.

SET_NC_WORKCELL_PARAM.description: Sets the value of a NC workcell parameter.

SET_NEXT_MDL_NAME.description: Sets the next available name for this model. Since Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire M070 this command also uses the PDMLink auto numbering.

SET_NOTE_TEXT.description: Sets the text of an existing note.

SET_ON_DRW_LAYER.description: Places geometry elements, features, parts or sub-assemblies on a drawing layer. The layer will be created if it does not exist yet.

SET_ON_LAYER.description: Places geometry elements, features, parts or sub-assemblies on a layer. The layer will be created if it does not exist yet.

SET_ORIENTATION.description: Sets the current view of a model by specifying its name.

SET_ORIENTATION_BY_REF.description: Sets the current view of a model by specifying its orientation references.

SET_ORIENTATION_MATRIX.description: Sets the current view of a model by specifying its orientation matrix.

SET_ORIENTATION_NAME.description: Renames an orientation of a solid model. This command is available since Creo 3.0 M140 / Creo 4.0 M020 and above.

SET_PRO_PROGRAM_INPUT.description: Sets the input section information of Pro/PROGRAM from a model.

SET_READONLY.description: Sets read-only mode of a model.

SET_REF_NAME.description: Sets name to a specified reference in Creo Elements/Pro.

SET_REF_PARAM.description: Creates or updates a reference parameter. This can be used to create or update parameters to annotation elements, surfaces, quilts, edges, curves and composite curves.

SET_REF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION.description: Sets the description of a Creo reference parameter.

SET_REF_PARAM_LOCK_STATUS.description: Sets the lock status of a Creo reference parameter.

SET_REF_POS.description: Sets the internal position on a geometrical reference. This is especially helpful if the reference was searched and not selected. For example the exact location on an edge could be specified. In case the location is not on the geometrical reference the closest position will be used.

SET_REGISTRY_STRING.description: Sets text to a registry value.

SET_REGISTRY_STRINGS.description: Sets an array of strings to a registry value.

SET_RELATIONS_UNIT_SENSITIVE.description: Sets the sensitivity state of the model relations. This command requires Creo 2.0 M110 or above.

SET_RETURN_VALUE.description: Sets the return value for a program file. This is currently only used for the notifications to prevent the feature or model related operations.

SET_SIMPREP_DEFAULT_ACTION.description: Ses the default action for an existing simplified representation.

SET_SIMPREP_NAME.description: Renames a simplified representation of a model. This works only for assemblies, but not for parts.

SET_SMT_FEAT_BENDTABLE.description: Applies a bend table to a Pro/SHEETMETAL bend or wall feature. The Pro/ENGINEER bend table must not include periods after the file extension (sample.bnd intead of sample.bnd.1).

SET_SMT_MDL_BENDTABLE.description: Applies a bend table to a Pro/SHEETMETAL part. The Pro/ENGINEER bend table must not include periods after the file extension (sample.bnd intead of sample.bnd.1).

SET_SYMBOL_GROUP_SHOWN.description: Sets a symbol group visible or not visible.

SET_SYMBOL_VAR_TEXT.description: Sets the variable text of a symbol by its name.

SET_TBLPATTERN_DATA.description: Updates table pattern with data from an array.

SET_TBLPATTERN_TABLE.description: Activates a specific table of a table pattern.

SET_TEXTURE_PLACEMENT_PROPS.description: Sets the texture placement properties of assemblies, parts, components or surfaces.

SET_TEXTURE_PROPS.description: Sets the texture properties of assemblies, parts, components or surfaces.

SET_UNIT_LENGTH.description: Sets the unit system of a model with the specified unit for length.

SET_UNIT_SYSTEM.description: Sets the unit system of a model.

SET_VARIED_ITEM_STATE.description: Sets the state of a varied item of an inheritance feature or a flexible component. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 4 or above.

SET_VARIED_ITEM_VALUE.description: Sets the value of a varied item of an inheritance feature or a flexible component. This function requires Pro/ENGINEER Wildfire 4 or above.

SET_WORKING_DIRECTORY.description: Sets the working directory to a specified path.

SHOW_DIM.description: Shows one dimension or an array of dimensions.

SHOW_DIM_ANNOTATION.description: Converts a solid dimension to an annotation dimension.

SHOW_DIMS.description: Shows dimensions of a specific feature or model.

SHOW_DRW_FORMAT.description: Shows or hides the format of a drawing sheet. This command is only available for Creo 2.0 and above.

SHOW_DRW_SHEET_DIM.description: Shows existing Creo Elements/Pro dimension on a drawing sheet specifying the dimension of the solid model.

SHOW_DRW_VIEW_ANNOTATION.description: Shows existing Creo Elements/Pro annotations like a note on a drawing view by specifying the annotation of the solid model.

SHOW_DRW_VIEW_DIM.description: Shows existing Creo Elements/Pro dimension in a drawing view by specifying the dimension of the solid model.

SHOW_HELP.description: Enables a help button in the graphical user interface. If the help button is clicked the specified web page will be opened.

SHOW_PARAM.description: Shows current value of the parameter in an information dialog box.

SHOW_URL.description: Displays an URL in the embedded Creo Elements/Pro web browser.

SKETCH_USE_EDGE.description: Redefines the sketch of a feature according to the shape of a surface or curve by using its edges. The feature will become dependent to the source surface or curve.

SLEEP.description: Suspends the execution for a specified number of seconds.

SMARTHOLECHART_EXEC.description: Executes the search for bore information in SMARTHolechart. SMARTHolechart must be active in the Creo session in order to run this command. It requires the SMARTHolechart version 8.0 M020 or newer.

SMARTUPDATE_EXEC.description: Executes SMARTUpdate for a specified model with a specified configuration. SMARTUpdate must be active in the Creo session in order to run this command. It requires the SMARTUpdate version 8.0 M010 or newer.

SORT_ARRAY.description: Sorts all elements of an array. Sub arrays are sorted.

body: ! CHECK FOR SQLITE DRIVER  - NECESSARY FOR APP - ELEGANT EXIT
PLUGIN CAPTURE_OUTPUT powershell_output1 HIDE SYNC @"C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" "/c Get-OdbcDriver"
PLUGIN CAPTURE_OUTPUT powershell_output2 HIDE SYNC @"C:\WINDOWS\SYSWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" "/c Get-OdbcDriver"
FIND_ARRAY_ELEM found_drivers "Name      : SQLite3 ODBC Driver" index

MESSAGE_BOX_EX WARNING "NECESSARY DRIVER MISSING" "Your installation is currently missing a necessary SQLITE3 driver.\nPlease install from MBD_CHECKER\\\\SOFTWARE directory.\nE.g., using sqliteodbc.exe or sqliteodbc_w64.exe" arrayButtons paramChoice
sql_command = " UPDATE MBD_TABLE  SET ONE = \\'\'ABC\\' WHERE TWO > 3;"
sql_command = " UPDATE MBD_TABLE  SET (ONE,TWO) VALUES (\\'\'ABC\\' , 3 ) WHERE THREE > 3;"
sql_command = " SELECT SA_GEO_CHAR_SYMBOL_NAME FROM MBD_TABLES  WHERE STANDARD = " + "\'" + tol_standard + "\'" + ";"

STOP.description: Shows a string menu in Creo Elements/Pro. Creo Elements/Pro becomes active until is pressed in the string menu.

STOP_EX.description: Shows a STOP dialog. Creo becomes active until pressed.

STRING_TO_REFERENCE.description: Constructs a reference variable from two strings. The first string contains the name and extension of the model which owns the reference. The second string contains the reference content.

SUB_PICTURE.description: Specifies an overlaying gif image related to the global picture in the dialog box. In case the configuration option IMAGE_GRAPHICS is set to GDIPLUS, also bmp, jpeg and tiff images can be used.

SUBSTITUTE_SIMPREP.description: Substitutes a simplified representation of a component. This works only for assemblies, but not for parts.

SWITCH_TO_MAIN_MDL.description: Drawing operations require to switch automatically the current model to the drawing. Use this command to switch back to the main model.

SWITCH_TO_MDL.description: Makes a specific model the current Creo Elements/Pro model.

SWITCH_TO_MDL_POST.description: Switches to a specified model after the tab file was processed.

TERMINATE_PROE.description: Terminates the active Pro/ENGINEER / Creo session.

TK_GET_HANDLE_FROM_REGISTRY.description: Retrieves the handle from the Creo Toolkit dll from registry. This works only if the Toolkit application writes the result of ProToolkitDllIdGet to the windows registry. The registry key is: . At the end of the application the Toolkit dll should remove this information again from registry. As path it is recommended to use company name/application name.

TK_TASK_EXEC.description: Executes a task of a loaded Creo Toolkit dll.

TOOLKIT_FUNCTION_CALL.description: Executes a function of another Pro/TOOLKIT dll which is running as an auxiliary application.

TOOLKIT_TASK_EXEC.description: Executes a task of a loaded SmartAssembly Toolkit dll.

TOUCH.description: Updates the date and time of an existing file or folder or creates a new empty file. The command works similar to the UNIX. The main use of this command is to update the date and time stamp of a folder. Since Creo Parametric buffers the information about models in a directory, copying models by the operation system and trying to retrieve them could cause failures. This could be prevented by updating the date and time stamp.

TRANSPOSE_ARRAY.description: Retrieves an array which switches row and column location of an array with sub-arrays. This is similar to computing a transposed matrix.

TRIM_TO_PART.description: Trims a library part against the solid surfaces of a specified model.

UNDECLARE_MDL_NOTEBOOK.description: Undeclares a solid model from a notebook.

UNDO_CHECKOUT_OBJECTS.description: Revokes the checkout of an object in PDMLink.

UNERASE_DRW_ANNOTATION.description: Shows an erased drawing annotation again.

UNHIDE.description: Unhides a feature. This command requires Creo Elements/Pro Wildfire 4 or above.

UNLINK_SKETCH.description: Converts the external sketch of a feature to an internal one, similar like the unlink button in the Edit Definition dialog.

UNMERGE_DRW_TABLE.description: Un-merges the cells in the specified rectangle of a drawing table.

UNSET_FLEXIBLE.description: Removes flexibility from a component. This function requires Creo 1.0 or above.

UNSET_READONLY.description: Removes read-only mode of a model.

UPDATE_ALL_DRW_SYMBOLS.description: Updates all drawing symbols to the latest version.

UPDATE_DIRECTORY_IDX.description: Updates the idx family table file for a directory.

UPDATE_DRW_VIEWS.description: Updates drawing views on a specific drawing sheet.

USE_LIBRARY_MDL.description: Uses a library model with an operation like in the .

USER_COLLECT.description: Allows to select surface sets and edge or curve chains by the help of the collection interfaces.

USER_DROP_DOWN.description: Adds a drop down to the graphical user interface. A drop down provides the functionality to select one item.

USER_INPUT_PARAM.description: Prompts input from the user and stores the result to a parameter.

USER_LIST_BOX.description: Adds a list box to the graphical user interface. A list box provides the functionality to select one or many items.

USER_SELECT.description: Prompts the user to select a reference in the Creo Elements/Pro model.

USER_SELECT_MULTIPLE.description: Prompts the user to select an array of reference in the Creo Elements/Pro model.

USER_SELECT_MULTIPLE_OPTIONAL.description: Prompts the user to select an array of reference in the Creo Elements/Pro model. The selection could be skipped.

USER_SELECT_OPTIONAL.description: Prompts the user to select a reference in the Creo Elements/Pro model. The selection could be skipped.

USER_TEXT_BOX.description: Adds a multi line text box the graphical user interface.

USER_YESNO_PARAM.description: Prompts a boolean decision from the user and stores the result to a parameter. The information can either be entered as a text or by using the buttons in the message line.

VECTOR_CROSS_PRODUCT.description: Calculates the cross product (also called vector product or outer product) of two vectors.

VECTOR_DOT_PRODUCT.description: Calculates the dot product (also called scalar product or inner product) of two vectors.

VECTOR_FROM_POINTS.description: Calculates the direction vector from a start point to an end point.

VECTOR_GET_LENGTH.description: Calculates the length of a vector.

VECTOR_NORMALIZE.description: Normalizes a vector to the unit length 1.

VERIFY_FAMINSTANCE.description: Verifies one or all family table instances of a specified family table.

VERIFY_RELATIONS.description: Verifies the relations of a reference and returns if they are valid.

WAIT.description: Shows a window with a button and waits until the user has clicked on it.

WAIT_FOR_FILE.description: Waits until a file is created.

WEBSERVICE_CALL.description: Sends are web service request by the RESTful architecture style.

WHILE.description: Processes a loop over a code sequence as long as a condition is true.

WINDOW_ACTIVATE.description: Activates the window after the tab files was processed.

WINDOW_CLOSE.description: Closes the window after the tab files was processed.

WINWORD_CONNECT.description: Establishes a connection to Microsoft Word. In case Word is not already running, it will be launched. Otherwise a connection to the already running Word program is established.

WINWORD_DISCONNECT.description: Terminates a connection to Microsoft Word.

WINWORD_GET_BOOKMARK_TEXT.description: Searches in the current Word document for a bookmark and stores the content to a .

WINWORD_GET_BOOKMARKS.description: Retrieves an array of all bookmarks names from the current Word document.

WINWORD_LOAD_DOCUMENT.description: Retrieves a new Word document specified by the name. The document could be located either in library or in working directory.

WINWORD_REPLACE.description: Replaces text in the current Word document.

WINWORD_SAVE_DOCUMENT.description: Saves a Word document specified by the name. The document could be located either in library or in working directory.

WINWORD_SET_BOOKMARK_TEXT.description: Searches in the current Word document for a bookmark and replaces the content with the new text.

WRITE_EXTERNAL_DATA.description: Writes external data by keyword to a model. The data could be a string value or an array of string values.

WRITE_LOG_MESSAGE.description: Writes output to a log file in case the message logging mode is enabled.

WRITE_TRAIL_MESSAGE.description: Writes a tagged message to the trail file. This command is helpful in combination with the configuration option DEBUG_TRAIL_FILE to track complex problems.

XML_ADD_NODE.description: Adds a new node as child of the XML document or of a parent node.

XML_ADD_NODE_ATTRIBUTE.description: Adds an attribute to an existing node.

XML_DOCUMENT_TO_STRING.description: Converts an existing XML document to a string.

XML_FORMAT_DOCUMENT.description: Formats an existing XML document with indentions and line breaks.

XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE_NAME.description: Gets the name of an existing attribute.

XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE_VALUE.description: Gets the value of an existing node.

XML_GET_NODE.description: Retrieves a node from a XML document or from a parent node.

XML_GET_NODE_ATTRIBUTE.description: Retrieves an attribute from an existing node.

XML_GET_NODE_ATTRIBUTES.description: Retrieves an array of attributes from an existing node.

XML_GET_NODE_NAME.description: Gets the name of an existing node.

XML_GET_NODE_TYPE.description: Gets the type of an existing node.

XML_GET_NODE_VALUE.description: Gets the value of an existing node.

XML_GET_NODES.description: Retrieves nodes from a XML document or from a parent node.

XML_GET_SIBLING_NODE.description: Retrieves a sibling of a XML node.

XML_GET_SIBLING_NODES.description: Retrieves siblings of a XML node.

XML_INIT_DOCUMENT.description: Initializes a XML document from string.

XML_LOAD_DOCUMENT.description: Loads a XML document from file, http or ftp connection.

XML_NEW_DOCUMENT.description: Creates a new XML document which just includes the instruction line.

XML_QUERY_VALUES.description: Queries values from a XML document or from a parent node.

XML_SAVE_DOCUMENT.description: Saves a XML document to disk.

XML_SET_NODE_VALUE.description: Sets the value of an existing node.

ZIP.description: Zips files and folders to a zip file. When a folder is specified all includes files will be added recursively.

ZOOM_TO_POS.description: Zooms to a position in the current model on the screen.

ZOOM_TO_REF.description: Zooms to a reference in the current model on the screen.
